definition.zh: （地质）断层作用导致的岩层向下的垂直位移；也可指断层中下移的一侧（下盘相对下移）。

examples.en: The map shows a major fault with a downthrow to the east.
examples.zh: 地图显示一条主要断层，东侧发生下落位移（downthrow）。

examples.en: Miners had to adjust the tunnel route because the coal seam had a downthrow of several meters.
examples.zh: 由于煤层发生了几米的下落位移，矿工不得不调整巷道路线。

definition.en: To cause (a rock layer) to move downward along a fault; to downthrow.
definition.zh: （地质）（使岩层）沿断层向下错动；使发生下落位移。

examples.en: Tectonic forces downthrew the strata along the fault line.
examples.zh: 构造力使地层沿断层线向下错动。

extraExplanation: 在断层里常用“hanging wall（上盘）”与“footwall（下盘）”来描述两侧岩块的相对运动：如果上盘相对下盘向下移动，就常说发生了downthrow（下落位移）；相反方向常称为upthrow（上抛位移）。
这个词多见于地质剖面图、矿业与工程地质报告中，用来说明地层被断层“错开”了多少高度（throw/位移量）。

summary.en: Downthrown most commonly means “moved downward,” especially the lowered side of a geological fault; less commonly, it can mean “thrown/knocked down.”
summary.zh: Downthrown 最常指“向下错动的”，尤指断层中下移的一侧；较少情况下也可指“被扔倒/击倒的”。

definition.en: (Geology/engineering) Displaced downward, especially describing the side of a fault or a rock layer that has moved down relative to the other side.
definition.zh: （地质/工程）向下错动的；（尤指断层中）相对另一侧下移的一侧或下移的岩层。

examples.en: The downthrown block lies on the east side of the fault.
examples.zh: 断层的东侧是下盘（下移的一侧）。

examples.en: Geologists mapped a downthrown layer that dropped several meters.
examples.zh: 地质学家绘制出一条向下错动、下移了数米的地层。

definition.en: (General) Thrown or knocked down; forced to fall (past participle use, less common in everyday writing).
definition.zh: （一般用法）被扔倒/被击倒的；被迫倒下的（作过去分词用法，日常写作中较少见）。

examples.en: The downthrown fence was quickly repaired after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨后，被刮倒的栅栏很快就修好了。

examples.en: He lay downthrown on the ground for a moment, then stood up.
examples.zh: 他一度被击倒在地，随后又站了起来。

extraExplanation: 在地质学里，downthrown 常与 upthrown（上移的）成对出现，用来描述断层两侧的相对位移。对应的名词说法常见为 downthrown side / downthrown block（下盘/下移块体）。注意它强调“相对另一侧更低”，不一定等同于绝对高度更低。

summary.en: Downthrust means a force or movement pushing downward, or (in geology) a downward displacement along a fault.
summary.zh: downthrust 指向下的推力/下压；在地质中也指断层处岩层向下位移（下落盘）。

definition.en: a strong push, force, or movement directed downward
definition.zh: 向下的强力推压；向下的推动/运动

examples.en: The pile driver works by repeated downthrusts that drive the post into the ground.
examples.zh: 打桩机通过反复向下的冲击力把桩打入地面。

examples.en: He felt a sudden downthrust of the airplane as it hit turbulence.
examples.zh: 飞机遇到乱流时，他感觉到机身突然向下猛一沉。

definition.en: (geology) a downward displacement of rock layers along a fault; the downthrown side of a fault
definition.zh: （地质）断层处岩层向下错动；断层的下落盘/下盘

examples.en: The map shows a downthrust on the eastern side of the fault.
examples.zh: 地图显示断层东侧发生了向下错动（为下落盘）。

examples.en: Earthquakes can occur where a downthrust brings rock layers into sudden contact.
examples.zh: 当向下错动使岩层突然挤压接触时，可能会发生地震。

extraExplanation: 在日常英语里，downthrust 常指“向下的推力/下压”；在地质语境中，它常用来描述断层两侧岩层的“下落（下盘）”或“向下位移”。具体含义取决于文章是否在谈机械受力还是断层构造。

summary.en: Downtick means a small decrease or a slight downward move, especially in markets or statistics.
summary.zh: downtick 指（尤在市场或统计数据中）小幅下降、轻微下滑。

definition.en: A small downward movement in a level, value, or rate (especially in prices, markets, or statistics).
definition.zh: （数值、水平或比率的）小幅下跌；（尤指）价格或市场的轻微下滑。

examples.en: We saw a downtick in inflation last month.
examples.zh: 上个月通胀出现了小幅回落。

examples.en: After the news, the stock had a brief downtick before recovering.
examples.zh: 消息出来后，这只股票先短暂下挫，随后又回升。

definition.en: To decrease slightly; to show a small downward movement.
definition.zh: 小幅下降；略微下滑。

examples.en: Sales downticked in the first quarter.
examples.zh: 第一季度销量略有下滑。

examples.en: If unemployment downticks again, confidence may rise.
examples.zh: 如果失业率再次小幅下降，信心可能会回升。

extraExplanation: “downtick”常见于财经与数据语境，语气比“drop/fall”更轻，强调“幅度不大、短期波动”。
词形来自“down + tick”。这里的“tick”可理解为“（图表/钟表的）一小格、一小步”，所以“downtick”就是“向下的一小步”。
近义但语感不同：dip（短暂下滑，常暗示会回升）、decline（较正式/更持续）、drop（更口语或幅度更明显）。反义词常用：uptick（小幅上升）。

summary.en: Downtime means time when a system is not running, or your free time to rest.
summary.zh: Downtime 指系统停机的时间，或个人用于休息放松的空闲时间。

definition.en: a period when a machine, system, or service is not operating (often because of maintenance or a problem)
definition.zh: （机器、系统或服务）停机时间；无法运行的时段（常因维护或故障）

examples.en: The website had two hours of downtime during the upgrade.
examples.zh: 网站在升级期间停机了两个小时。

examples.en: We schedule maintenance at night to reduce downtime for customers.
examples.zh: 我们把维护安排在夜间，以减少客户的停机时间。

definition.en: free time when you are not working or busy; time to rest or relax
definition.zh: 空闲时间；休息放松的时间

examples.en: I read novels in my downtime after work.
examples.zh: 我下班后的空闲时间会读小说。

examples.en: Even ten minutes of downtime can help you recharge.
examples.zh: 哪怕十分钟的休息时间也能帮你恢复精力。

extraExplanation: 在工作与科技语境里，downtime 常与 uptime（正常运行时间）成对出现：例如 “99.9% uptime”。
在 IT/运维里常见搭配：planned downtime（计划内停机）、unplanned downtime（意外停机）、minimize downtime（将停机时间降到最低）。
在日常生活里，downtime 带有“有意留白、放松恢复”的积极意味，接近 “me time / break”。

summary.en: “Downtimes” means multiple periods when a system is not working or when activity is low and you have free time.
summary.zh: “downtimes”指多段停机/中断时间，或多段活动减少的空闲时段。

definition.en: periods when a machine, system, or service is not operating (often because of repairs, maintenance, or a failure)
definition.zh: （机器、系统或服务的）停机时间；（常因维修、保养或故障导致的）中断时间

examples.en: The website had several downtimes last month because of server upgrades.
examples.zh: 上个月由于服务器升级，这个网站出现了几次停机。

examples.en: We schedule maintenance at night to reduce downtimes for customers.
examples.zh: 我们把维护安排在夜间，以减少客户的停机时间。

definition.en: periods when work or activity is low, giving time to rest or do other tasks
definition.zh: （工作或活动较少的）空闲时间；清闲时段

examples.en: During downtimes at work, she studies English vocabulary.
examples.zh: 工作空闲时，她会学习英语词汇。

examples.en: Airports can be busy, but there are downtimes between flights.
examples.zh: 机场可能很忙，但航班之间也会有空档时间。

extraExplanation: “downtimes”是“downtime”的复数，表示多段停机/空闲时段。科技与商业语境里最常见：例如系统维护（planned downtime）与故障导致的中断（unplanned downtime）。
常见搭配：reduce/minimize downtime（减少停机），experience downtime（经历停机），scheduled/unscheduled downtime（计划/非计划停机）。

summary.en: “Downton” is mainly known as a name—especially from the TV series Downton Abbey—and it can also function as a place name.
summary.zh: “Downton”主要作为名称使用——尤其因《唐顿庄园》而知名——也可能是地名。

definition.en: a family name (surname), especially recognized today because of the British TV drama “Downton Abbey.”
definition.zh: 一个姓氏（家族姓），如今尤其因英国电视剧《唐顿庄园》（Downton Abbey）而广为人知。

examples.en: Many viewers first encountered the name “Downton” through the series Downton Abbey.
examples.zh: 许多观众第一次接触“Downton”这个名字，是通过电视剧《唐顿庄园》。

examples.en: In the show, “Downton” refers to the estate where the story is set.
examples.zh: 在剧中，“Downton”指故事发生的那座庄园（地产）。

definition.en: a place name that can exist in English-speaking regions (often formed from “down” + “-ton,” meaning a settlement/town).
definition.zh: 一个地名（在英语地区可能出现），常由“down（丘陵/高地）+ -ton（村镇/聚落）”构成。

examples.en: Some English place names end in “-ton,” which often means “town” or “settlement.”
examples.zh: 一些英国地名以“-ton”结尾，常表示“城镇”或“聚落”。

examples.en: If you see “Downton” on a map, it may be the name of a village or district.
examples.zh: 如果你在地图上看到“Downton”，它可能是某个村庄或地区的名字。

extraExplanation: 《唐顿庄园》中的“Downton”是虚构庄园名；现实拍摄主要在海克利尔城堡（Highclere Castle）。
词源上，“-ton”来自古英语 tūn，原意偏“围起来的居住地/农庄”，后来泛指“村镇”；“down”在英式地名里常与丘陵草地、起伏高地相关。

summary.en: Downton is a place name best known as the fictional estate in Downton Abbey.
summary.zh: Downton 是一个地名，最常见的联想是《唐顿庄园》中虚构的庄园。

definition.en: A place name (proper noun), especially known from the British TV drama Downton Abbey; it refers to the fictional estate and village “Downton.”
definition.zh: 地名（专有名词），尤其因英国电视剧《唐顿庄园》（Downton Abbey）而广为人知；在剧中指虚构的庄园与村庄“Downton/唐顿”。

examples.en: Have you watched Downton Abbey? Downton is the estate where the story happens.
examples.zh: 你看过《唐顿庄园》吗？Downton 是故事发生的庄园。

examples.en: In the series, life at Downton changes after World War I.
examples.zh: 在这部剧里，一战后唐顿的生活发生了变化。

extraExplanation: “Downton”在现实中也可能是英国某些地方的地名，但在英语语境里，很多人一看到这个词会立刻联想到电视剧《Downton Abbey》（中文常译《唐顿庄园》）。
“Abbey”意为“修道院”，但剧名《Downton Abbey》指的是一座贵族庄园（类似“Downton 庄园”），并不一定真的是修道院建筑。

summary.en: “Downtown” usually means the city center or business district, and it can be a noun, adverb, or adjective.
summary.zh: “Downtown” 通常指城市的市中心/商业区，可作名词、副词或形容词使用。

definition.en: the central part of a city where many offices, shops, and entertainment places are located
definition.zh: （城市的）市中心；商业区（通常有很多办公楼、商店与娱乐场所）

examples.en: Let’s meet downtown after work.
examples.zh: 下班后我们在市中心见吧。

examples.en: Downtown is busy during the day but quieter at night.
examples.zh: 市中心白天很忙，晚上更安静一些。

definition.en: in or to the central part of a city
definition.zh: 在（或去）市中心

examples.en: We drove downtown to eat dinner.
examples.zh: 我们开车去市中心吃晚饭。

examples.en: She works downtown and lives in the suburbs.
examples.zh: 她在市中心上班，住在郊区。

definition.en: located in the central part of a city
definition.zh: 位于市中心的

examples.en: They booked a downtown hotel.
examples.zh: 他们订了一家市中心的酒店。

examples.en: Downtown streets are often crowded.
examples.zh: 市中心的街道常常很拥挤。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里，downtown 很常见，通常指“商业与办公最集中的核心区”。在一些城市（如纽约），人们也会用 downtown 指“往南边的方向”（如 Manhattan 的下城），但最常见的意思仍是“市中心/商业区”。
英式英语里更常用 city centre（市中心）；在北美语境中，downtown 更自然。

summary.en: A “downtowner” is someone associated with a city’s downtown area.
summary.zh: “downtowner” 指与城市市中心（downtown）密切相关的人。

definition.en: a person who lives, works, or spends a lot of time in a city’s downtown area
definition.zh: 住在、在市中心工作，或经常在市中心活动的人

examples.en: Many downtowners walk to work instead of driving.
examples.zh: 很多住在市中心的人走路上班，而不是开车。

examples.en: The café is popular with downtowners on weekday mornings.
examples.zh: 这家咖啡馆在工作日早上很受市中心常客欢迎。

extraExplanation: 在美国英语里，downtown 通常指城市的中心商业区（写字楼、商店、公共交通密集）。相对的说法常见有 uptown（城市较北/较高处或更偏住宅的区域）以及 suburb（郊区）。不同城市对 downtown 的边界和“氛围”可能不一样。

summary.en: “Downtowns” means the central business areas of multiple cities or towns.
summary.zh: “downtowns”指多个城市/城镇的市中心（商业中心）。

definition.en: the central business areas of cities or towns (plural of “downtown”); usually where many offices, shops, and government buildings are
definition.zh: （downtown 的复数）城市或城镇的市中心/商业中心；通常是办公、购物与政府机构集中的地区

examples.en: Many downtowns have become quieter since more people started working from home.
examples.zh: 自从更多人开始居家办公后，许多城市的市中心变得更安静了。

examples.en: The report compares housing prices in downtowns and suburbs.
examples.zh: 这份报告比较了市中心和郊区的房价。

examples.en: Tourists often visit downtowns for museums, shopping, and historic buildings.
examples.zh: 游客常去市中心参观博物馆、购物和看历史建筑。

extraExplanation: “downtown”在美式英语里很常见，通常指“城市的商业中心”。在一些城市里，人们也会用“city center”（较中性/通用）或在英国更常见的“city centre”。
复数“downtowns”常用于讨论多个城市的市中心（如研究、新闻报道、城市规划等语境），例如“revitalizing downtowns”（振兴市中心）。

summary.en: “Downtownward” means moving or pointing toward downtown.
summary.zh: “downtownward”表示“朝市中心方向”。

definition.en: Toward downtown; in the direction of the central business part of a city.
definition.zh: 朝市中心（商业区）方向；往城里去。

examples.en: We walked downtownward to find a place to eat.
examples.zh: 我们朝市中心方向走去，想找个地方吃饭。

examples.en: Traffic gets heavier as you drive downtownward in the evening.
examples.zh: 傍晚开车往市中心走时，车流会更拥堵。

extraExplanation: “downtownward”是由“downtown（市中心）+ -ward（朝……方向）”构成的方向副词，但在现代英语中较少见。日常表达更常用“toward downtown / into downtown / downtown”。

summary.en: Downtrampling means trampling something down physically, or (more often figuratively) oppressing and humiliating people by treating them as beneath you.
summary.zh: Downtrampling 指把东西踩踏压扁（字面），更常指（比喻）对他人的压迫与践踏，把人当作低人一等。

definition.en: the act of trampling something down (literally stepping on it repeatedly) or crushing it underfoot
definition.zh: 把某物踩踏压扁的行为（字面：反复踩踏）；也可指用脚踩碎、踩坏

examples.en: The downtrampling of the grass left a muddy path across the field.
examples.zh: 草地被踩踏得东倒西歪，田野里留下了一条泥泞的小路。

examples.en: Signs asked visitors to avoid the downtrampling of young plants.
examples.zh: 告示牌提醒游客避免踩踏幼苗。

definition.en: the act of harshly pushing people down—treating them as unimportant, denying rights, or controlling them by force (figurative)
definition.zh: （比喻）对他人的压迫与践踏——把人不当回事、剥夺权利，或用强硬手段控制

examples.en: The novel criticizes the downtrampling of the poor by the powerful.
examples.zh: 这部小说批判强者对穷人的压迫与践踏。

examples.en: She spoke out against the downtrampling of workers’ voices in the workplace.
examples.zh: 她公开反对在职场中压制工人声音的做法。

definition.en: crushing or oppressing; treating others as beneath you (used before a noun)
definition.zh: （用于名词前）压制性的；践踏他人的；高压的

examples.en: He criticized the company’s downtrampling policies toward unions.
examples.zh: 他批评公司对工会采取的高压政策。

examples.en: They resisted a downtrampling style of leadership.
examples.zh: 他们反对那种压制性的领导方式。

extraExplanation: “downtrampling”不是最常见的日常词，更常见的表达是“trampling (on)”（践踏/蹂躏）、“oppression”（压迫）、“bullying”（霸凌）、“suppression”（打压）。
在比喻义里常与介词 on 连用：trample on someone’s rights（践踏某人的权利）。如果你想更自然地表达“对弱者的践踏”，常写作：the powerful trampling on the weak。

summary.en: “Downtreading” is not standard; it usually means “downtrending,” describing a downward trend over time.
summary.zh: “downtreading”不是标准用法；通常指“downtrending”，表示随时间呈下降趋势。

definition.en: Likely a misspelling of “downtrending”: moving downward over time (often used for prices, sales, or data).
definition.zh: 很可能是“downtrending”的拼写错误：随时间呈下降趋势（常用于价格、销量或数据）。

examples.en: The stock has been downtrending since last month.
examples.zh: 这只股票从上个月开始一直在下跌（呈下降趋势）。

examples.en: Sales are downtrending, so we need a new marketing plan.
examples.zh: 销量在走低，所以我们需要新的营销方案。

definition.en: If used as a verb form (less common): to trend downward; to show a downward pattern over time.
definition.zh: 若当作动词用（较少见）：呈下降趋势；随时间显示出下行走势。

examples.en: After the announcement, the price started downtrending.
examples.zh: 公告发布后，价格开始走低。

extraExplanation:
“downtreading”不是常见标准拼写。你可能想写的是：
1) downtrending（常见于金融/数据分析语境，表示“持续下行”）；
2) downtrend（名词，表示“下降趋势”）。
例：a downtrend in housing prices（房价的下降趋势）。
在技术分析里，downtrend 常指价格形成“更低的高点”和“更低的低点”（lower highs, lower lows），用来描述持续的下行走势。

summary.en: A downtrend is a sustained movement downward over time, especially in markets or business metrics.
summary.zh: Downtrend 指（市场或商业指标等）在一段时间内持续向下的趋势。

definition.en: a general downward movement over time, especially in prices, sales, or other measurable values
definition.zh: （尤指价格、销量等）持续一段时间的下行趋势

examples.en: The stock has been in a downtrend for three months.
examples.zh: 这只股票已经下跌趋势持续了三个月。

examples.en: Sales entered a downtrend after the holiday season ended.
examples.zh: 假期结束后，销量进入下行趋势。

extraExplanation: “Downtrend”常见于金融与商业语境，强调“趋势性下跌”，比单次的“drop/fall（下跌）”更突出“持续一段时间”。技术分析里常用的判断方式是：价格不断出现“更低的高点（lower highs）”和“更低的低点（lower lows）”。
相关搭配：in a downtrend（处于下行趋势）、a prolonged downtrend（长期下行）、reverse/break the downtrend（扭转/打破下行趋势）。

summary.en: “Downtrends” means several periods or patterns of overall decline over time, especially in markets or data.
summary.zh: “downtrends”指多个（或一系列）随时间整体下降的趋势，尤用于市场或数据。

definition.en: a general movement or pattern of falling values, levels, or popularity over time (often used in finance, markets, or data).
definition.zh: （数值、水平或受欢迎程度等）随时间总体下降的趋势；常用于金融市场或数据分析。

examples.en: Tech stocks showed several downtrends during the year.
examples.zh: 科技股在这一年里出现了好几段下跌趋势。

examples.en: The report warns of downtrends in customer satisfaction.
examples.zh: 报告警告客户满意度呈下降趋势。

extraExplanation: “downtrend”在技术分析里常与“uptrend（上升趋势）”相对。交易语境中常说“in a downtrend（处于下跌趋势中）”，并会结合“lower highs and lower lows（更低的高点与更低的低点）”来描述走势特征。
形式上，downtrends 是复数；单数是 downtrend。也常写作 down trends（较少见、偏非正式）。

summary.en: “Downtrod” usually means “downtrodden”: oppressed or treated unfairly; it can also be a rare past form of “downtread.”
summary.zh: “downtrod”通常表示“downtrodden”：受压迫、被不公平对待；也可作“downtread”的罕见过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: (adj.) Oppressed, treated unfairly, or kept in a low social or economic position; a less common/older form of “downtrodden.”
definition.zh: （形容词）受压迫的；被不公平对待的；处于社会或经济底层的（较少见/较旧的形式，相当于 downtrodden）。

examples.en: The novel focuses on the lives of the downtrod workers in the city.
examples.zh: 这部小说聚焦于城市里受压迫工人的生活。

examples.en: She spent her life speaking up for the downtrod and forgotten.
examples.zh: 她一生都在为受压迫、被遗忘的人发声。

definition.en: (vt., rare) Past tense/past participle of “downtread”: to trample on or crush (someone) underfoot; to oppress.
definition.zh: （及物动词，罕见）downtread 的过去式/过去分词：践踏；踩压；压迫（某人）。

examples.en: The conquerors downtrod the local people for decades.
examples.zh: 征服者数十年来压迫当地人民。

extraExplanation: “Downtrod”在现代英语里很少单独使用；更常见的是“downtrodden”。词源形象来自“down + tread（踩踏）”，带有“被踩在脚下”的隐喻，因此常用于描述社会压迫与不公。

summary.en: Downtrodden means oppressed and disadvantaged, or feeling defeated and discouraged.
summary.zh: Downtrodden 指长期受压迫、处于弱势的人（或群体），也可指因困境而沮丧、被打垮的状态。

definition.en: Oppressed or treated unfairly for a long time; having little power or money.
definition.zh: 长期受压迫、受不公平对待的；处于弱势或贫困的。

examples.en: The novel focuses on the lives of the downtrodden workers in the city.
examples.zh: 这部小说聚焦于城市里受压迫工人的生活。

examples.en: She volunteered at a shelter that supports the downtrodden and homeless.
examples.zh: 她在一家帮助弱势群体和无家可归者的收容所做志愿者。

definition.en: Feeling defeated, discouraged, or low in spirit (often because of hardship).
definition.zh: （常因困境而）沮丧的、被打垮的、意志消沉的。

examples.en: After months of job searching, he felt downtrodden but kept trying.
examples.zh: 找工作找了几个月后，他感到很沮丧，但仍继续努力。

examples.en: Her downtrodden expression showed she had received bad news.
examples.zh: 她沮丧的神情表明她收到了坏消息。

extraExplanation: “Downtrodden”字面意思是“被踩在脚下的”，常用于描述社会中的弱势群体（the downtrodden），语气带有同情与批判不公的色彩。
常见搭配：the downtrodden（弱势/受压迫的人们）、downtrodden people/communities（受压迫的群体）、a downtrodden look（沮丧的神情）。
近义词侧重点：oppressed（被压迫，强调制度/权力）；underprivileged（贫困/缺乏资源，较中性）；dejected/downcast（情绪低落，偏心理状态）。

summary.en: “Downtroddenness” means the condition of being oppressed, worn down, or treated badly for a long time.
summary.zh: “downtroddenness”指长期遭受压迫或不公对待而变得疲惫、贫困或失去希望的状态。

definition.en: The state of being downtrodden—treated unfairly or harshly over a long time, often leading to poverty, exhaustion, or loss of hope.
definition.zh: 被压迫、被欺凌的状态——长期遭受不公或苛待，常导致贫困、疲惫或失去希望。

examples.en: The novel shows the downtroddenness of workers who have no power to change their conditions.
examples.zh: 这部小说展现了工人们在无力改变处境时的受压迫状态。

examples.en: Years of discrimination created a deep sense of downtroddenness in the community.
examples.zh: 多年的歧视在这个群体中造成了深深的受压迫感。

examples.en: She tried to hide her downtroddenness at work, but her tired eyes told the truth.
examples.zh: 她试图在工作中掩饰自己的落魄与低沉，但疲惫的眼神出卖了她。

extraExplanation: “downtroddenness”来自形容词“downtrodden”（被踩在脚下的、受压迫的）。词根上“tread”是“踩/踏”，带有形象的隐喻：长期被“踩”就会变得卑微、贫困或丧失尊严。
这个词偏书面、文学或社会评论语境中使用；日常口语里更常说“misery（痛苦）”“poverty（贫穷）”“oppression（压迫）”或“feeling defeated（感到被打败）”。
文学与新闻中常用它来描写群体处境（如工人、弱势群体）的长期结构性困境，而不仅是短暂的难过。

summary.en: Downturn means a decline, especially in the economy or business, or a shift downward in trend or movement.
summary.zh: Downturn 指（尤指经济或商业的）下滑/衰退，也可指趋势或运动的向下转变。

definition.en: A decline in business, the economy, or activity; a period when things get worse, especially economically.
definition.zh: （商业、经济或活动的）下滑；衰退期；不景气。

examples.en: Many restaurants struggled during the economic downturn.
examples.zh: 在经济下滑期间，许多餐馆经营困难。

examples.en: Sales showed a downturn in the second quarter.
examples.zh: 第二季度的销量出现下滑。

definition.en: A turning downward movement or direction.
definition.zh: 向下转的动作或趋势；下降的方向。

examples.en: The bird’s wings made a sudden downturn before landing.
examples.zh: 那只鸟在着陆前翅膀突然向下转。

examples.en: On the chart, you can see a downturn after the peak.
examples.zh: 在图表上，你可以看到峰值后出现了下降趋势。

extraExplanation: “downturn”最常见于经济语境，常与 recession（衰退）、slowdown（放缓）一起出现：downturn 侧重“从好转坏的转折/下行阶段”，recession 更偏正式、常指较明确的经济衰退期。
常见搭配：economic/market downturn（经济/市场下滑）、a downturn in sales/demand（销量/需求下滑）、during the downturn（在低迷期）。
词源结构易记：down（向下）+ turn（转向）→ 事情“转向下行”。

summary.en: Downturn-hit describes people, places, or businesses that have been badly affected by an economic downturn.
summary.zh: downturn-hit 用来形容人、地区或企业等“因经济下行而受到严重冲击”的状态。

definition.en: Badly affected by an economic downturn (a period when business activity becomes weaker).
definition.zh: 受到经济下行（衰退）严重影响的；被经济不景气打击的。

examples.en: Many downturn-hit restaurants reduced staff and shortened opening hours.
examples.zh: 许多受经济下行打击的餐馆裁员并缩短营业时间。

examples.en: The city offered support to downturn-hit small businesses.
examples.zh: 该市为受经济下行影响的中小企业提供支持。

examples.en: She moved out of the downturn-hit region to look for work.
examples.zh: 她离开了受经济下行冲击的地区去找工作。

extraExplanation: “downturn-hit”常见于新闻与商业写作，是由“downturn（经济下行/衰退）+ hit（被打击的）”构成的连字符复合形容词，意思接近“hard-hit”。通常放在名词前作定语（downturn-hit industries/areas/companies）。在更口语或更自然的表达中，也可用“hit hard by the downturn / affected by the downturn”。

summary.en: “Downturn-related” means connected with an economic or market decline.
summary.zh: “downturn-related”表示“与经济或市场下行/衰退有关的”。

definition.en: Connected with an economic downturn (a period when the economy slows and business activity falls).
definition.zh: 与经济衰退（经济放缓、商业活动减少的时期）有关的。

examples.en: The company announced layoffs due to downturn-related cost cuts.
examples.zh: 由于与经济衰退相关的削减成本措施，公司宣布裁员。

examples.en: Many small businesses faced downturn-related declines in sales.
examples.zh: 许多小企业面临与经济衰退相关的销售下滑。

definition.en: Connected with a decline in a specific market or industry, not necessarily the whole economy.
definition.zh: 与某一特定市场或行业的下行/低迷有关（不一定是整体经济）。

examples.en: The airline reported downturn-related losses after travel demand dropped.
examples.zh: 在旅行需求下降后，这家航空公司报告了与行业低迷相关的亏损。

examples.en: The team delayed hiring because of downturn-related uncertainty in the tech sector.
examples.zh: 由于科技行业低迷带来的不确定性，团队推迟了招聘。

extraExplanation: “downturn-related”是由“downturn（下行、衰退）+ related（相关的）”构成的复合形容词，常见于新闻、商业报告等较正式的语境。
写作中常用连字符（-）把它当作“前置定语”使用：downturn-related layoffs（与衰退相关的裁员）。如果放在名词后作表语，也可写作 without hyphen：The layoffs are downturn related（较少见，正式写作仍常保留连字符）。

summary.en: Downturned means turned downward, and it often describes a sad or disappointed expression (especially a mouth or eyes).
summary.zh: downturned 表示“向下转的”，也常用来形容“显得沮丧或失望的表情”（尤指嘴角、眼神）。

definition.en: Turned downward; pointing or facing down.
definition.zh: 向下转的；朝下的。

examples.en: She wore a hat with a downturned brim to block the sun.
examples.zh: 她戴着一顶帽檐向下的帽子来遮阳。

examples.en: The downturned camera angle made the room look smaller.
examples.zh: 向下俯拍的镜头角度让房间看起来更小。

definition.en: Showing sadness, disappointment, or a lack of confidence (often describing a mouth, eyes, or expression).
definition.zh: （表情）显得沮丧的、失望的、缺乏自信的（常形容嘴角、眼神等）。

examples.en: His downturned mouth suggested he was disappointed.
examples.zh: 他嘴角下垂，显得很失望。

examples.en: She gave a downturned look when she heard the news.
examples.zh: 听到消息时，她露出沮丧的神情。

examples.en: The portrait captures a woman with downturned eyes.
examples.zh: 这幅肖像画刻画了一位眼神低垂的女性。

extraExplanation: “downturned”由 down（向下）+ turned（转向）构成，常见搭配有 downturned mouth/lips（嘴角下垂）、downturned eyes（眼神低垂）、downturned collar/brim（翻领/帽檐向下）。
和“downcast”意思接近，但“downturned”更强调“形状或角度向下”，而“downcast”更强调“情绪低落或目光垂下”。

summary.en: “Downturns” is the plural of “downturn,” meaning periods of economic weakness or any general decline.
summary.zh: “downturns”是“downturn”的复数，指经济不景气的时期，或更广义的任何下滑、下降。

definition.en: A period when the economy or a business becomes weaker (e.g., less spending, lower production, more unemployment).
definition.zh: （经济或企业的）衰退期；不景气（如消费减少、产量下降、失业上升）。

examples.en: Many companies cut hiring during economic downturns.
examples.zh: 在经济衰退期，许多公司会减少招聘。

examples.en: Small businesses often struggle most in downturns.
examples.zh: 小企业在不景气时期往往最难熬。

definition.en: A decline or drop in the level, quality, or activity of something (not only the economy).
definition.zh: （不仅指经济的）下降；下滑；走低（指水平、质量或活动减少）。

examples.en: The team faced a downturn in performance mid-season.
examples.zh: 这支球队在赛季中段出现了表现下滑。

examples.en: There was a downturn in attendance after the price increase.
examples.zh: 涨价后，出席人数有所下降。

extraExplanation: “downturn”常用于商业与新闻语境，和“recession（经济衰退）”意思接近，但范围更广：downturn 可以指较短或较轻的下滑；recession 更像正式的宏观经济衰退。
词形提醒：你输入的“downturns”是复数，常用于泛指“多次/各种下滑期”，如 “during downturns（在不景气时期）”。

summary.en: “Downvote” means to give a negative vote online, or the negative vote itself.
summary.zh: “downvote”指在网上点“踩/反对票”，也可指这个“踩”本身。

definition.en: to show you dislike or disagree with a post, comment, or answer online by clicking a “downvote” button, which usually lowers its score or visibility
definition.zh: （在网络平台上）点击“踩/反对票”来表示不喜欢或不同意某条内容，通常会降低其得分或曝光

examples.en: People downvoted the comment because it was rude.
examples.zh: 因为那条评论很无礼，大家给它点了踩。

examples.en: Please don’t downvote just because you disagree—explain your reasons.
examples.zh: 请不要仅仅因为不同意就点踩——可以说明你的理由。

examples.en: New users sometimes get downvoted for breaking the community rules.
examples.zh: 新用户有时会因为违反社区规则而被点踩。

definition.en: a negative vote on a website or app (the opposite of an upvote)
definition.zh: （网站/应用上的）反对票/踩（与 upvote“赞同票/顶”相对）

examples.en: The post received a lot of downvotes.
examples.zh: 这篇帖子收到了很多踩。

examples.en: One downvote can drop the answer’s ranking.
examples.zh: 一个踩就可能让这个回答的排名下降。

extraExplanation: “downvote”常见于Reddit等社区文化，表达的是对内容质量、相关性或态度的负面评价，但不同平台的潜台词不同：有的平台鼓励“对低质量/不相关内容点踩”，而不是“对不同观点点踩”。
写作时可用相关搭配：get downvoted（被点踩）、downvote something into oblivion（把某内容踩到几乎看不见，偏口语/夸张）、mass downvote（集体点踩）。

summary.en: “Downward” means toward a lower position (literal) or moving/going lower or worse (figurative).
summary.zh: “downward”表示“向下的/向下地”，也可引申为“下降、下滑、变差”的趋势。

definition.en: Moving or going toward a lower place, level, or position; toward the ground or bottom.
definition.zh: 向下的；朝较低处、地面或底部移动的。

examples.en: The path slopes downward to the river.
examples.zh: 这条小路向下倾斜通往河边。

examples.en: She looked downward to avoid eye contact.
examples.zh: 她向下看以避免眼神接触。

definition.en: Toward a lower place or level; down.
definition.zh: 向下；往较低处。

examples.en: The temperature is moving downward this week.
examples.zh: 这周气温在下降。

examples.en: He pushed the lever downward.
examples.zh: 他把拉杆向下压。

definition.en: Becoming worse, lower, or less successful (often used before nouns).
definition.zh: （趋势）下滑的；变差的；走低的（常用于名词前）。

examples.en: The company is on a downward trend in sales.
examples.zh: 这家公司销售额呈下滑趋势。

examples.en: He struggled with a downward spiral of stress and poor sleep.
examples.zh: 他陷入了压力增大与睡眠变差的恶性循环。

extraExplanation: “downward”既可表示真实的空间方向（向下走、向下看），也常用于抽象意义，表示“变差/减少/走低”。比如“downward trend（下行趋势）”“downward spiral（恶性循环、每况愈下）”是很常见的搭配。
日常口语中，表示方向时常用更短的“down”（go down, look down）。而“downward”更书面、更强调“朝下的方向/趋势”，常见于说明文、新闻和数据分析语境。

summary.en: forces that push economic activity weaker
summary.zh: 使经济走弱的下行压力

definition.en: economic forces that tend to slow growth, reduce demand, or push the economy toward weaker performance (such as recession risk, falling investment, or lower spending)
definition.zh: 对经济形成“向下拉力”的因素，可能导致增长放缓、需求下降或经济走弱（如衰退风险、投资减少、消费回落）

examples.en: High interest rates can put downward pressure on the economy by making borrowing more expensive.
examples.zh: 高利率会通过提高借贷成本，对经济形成向下压力。

examples.en: Rising unemployment adds downward pressure on the economy because households spend less.
examples.zh: 失业率上升会让家庭减少支出，从而对经济造成向下压力。

examples.en: Policymakers are watching for signs of downward pressure on the economy in the latest data.
examples.zh: 政策制定者正在从最新数据中寻找经济下行压力的迹象。

extraExplanation: 这是财经写作里很常见的中性表达，强调“正在产生拖累作用”，不一定等同于“经济已经衰退”。
常见近似说法：downward pressure on growth / on prices（分别指对增长或物价的下行压力）。
etymology: 源自常见搭配“downward pressure”，字面是“向下的压力”。在经济语境中用比喻方式把“拖累/压低表现的力量”说成“压力”，再加上“on the economy”明确作用对象。
mnemonic: 把经济想成电梯：downward pressure 就像有人按“下行”按钮，电梯更容易往下走＝经济更容易走弱。
pressure = 压力；downward = 向下。合起来记成“下压”。

summary.en: an overall movement toward lower levels over time
summary.zh: 总体呈下降的趋势

definition.en: a general movement or pattern of change toward lower levels, values, or amounts over time
definition.zh: （一段时间内）总体向下的变化趋势；下行趋势

examples.en: The chart shows a downward trend in sales over the last three months.
examples.zh: 图表显示过去三个月销售额呈下行趋势。

examples.en: There has been a downward trend in air pollution in the city since the new policy started.
examples.zh: 自新政策实施以来，这座城市的空气污染总体呈下降趋势。

examples.en: Analysts worry that the downward trend could continue into next year.
examples.zh: 分析师担心这种下行趋势可能会持续到明年。

extraExplanation: 常用于数据、图表、经济与商业语境：a downward trend in prices/inflation/sales/unemployment 等。
和 “downward trend” 很像但更口语/更短的是 “a decline” 或 “a downward slide”。如果强调“长期总体方向”，用 trend 更合适；强调“跌了多少/跌得很明显”，常用 decline / drop。
近义表达：downtrend（一个更偏金融/技术分析的写法，常作名词，用于股价走势）。
etymology: 由 down（向下）+ -ward（表示方向）构成 downward（向下的），trend 来自“转向/倾向”的含义，后来常用于描述统计、市场或社会现象的“趋势”。
mnemonic: 拆开记：down（下）+ ward（朝向）= 向下；trend = 趋势，所以就是“向下的趋势”。
联想股市K线往下走：整条线在“往下倾斜”，就是 downward trend。

summary.en: Downward-beating describes something that beats or moves downward repeatedly, or a strong falling pitch in speech/music.
summary.zh: downward-beating 形容反复向下拍打/击打的运动，也可指说话或音乐中明显下沉的音高走势。

definition.en: moving, striking, or pulsing downward in repeated beats (often describing wings, rain, light, a hand, etc.)
definition.zh: 以重复的“拍打/击打”方式向下运动的（常形容翅膀、雨、光、手势等）

examples.en: We watched the bird’s downward-beating wings as it landed.
examples.zh: 我们看着那只鸟向下拍打的翅膀降落。

examples.en: The dancer used a downward-beating rhythm with her hands to mark the tempo.
examples.zh: 舞者用向下拍击的手部节奏来标记拍子。

definition.en: (of melody or intonation) falling in pitch in a strong, beat-like way
definition.zh: （指旋律或语调）以明显的“拍点式”下降音高

examples.en: In the last line, his voice became downward-beating, sounding firm and final.
examples.zh: 在最后一句里，他的声音变成了明显下沉的“拍点式”语调，听起来坚定而收束。

extraExplanation: “downward-beating”常见为连字符形容词（由副词downward + 现在分词beating组成），多放在名词前作定语：downward-beating wings / downward-beating motion。也可写作downward beating（不加连字符）但作定语时加连字符更常见、更清晰。

summary.en: “Downward-bending” describes something that curves or bends toward a lower direction.
summary.zh: “downward-bending”表示某物朝较低方向弯曲或下垂。

definition.en: Bending or curving toward a lower position; turning downward rather than upward.
definition.zh: 向下弯曲的；朝下转折的（而不是向上）。

examples.en: The downward-bending branch dipped into the river.
examples.zh: 那根向下弯曲的树枝垂进了河里。

examples.en: Look for downward-bending leaves—this can be a sign the plant needs water.
examples.zh: 留意叶片向下弯曲——这可能表示植物缺水。

examples.en: The road became a downward-bending curve as it approached the valley.
examples.zh: 道路接近山谷时变成了向下弯曲的弯道。

extraExplanation: “downward-bending”是由副词downward（向下地）+现在分词bending（弯曲的）组成的复合形容词，常用连字符放在名词前作定语（如downward-bending branch）。不加连字符也可能出现（downward bending），但更像名词短语。

summary.en: Downward-curving describes something that bends or trends downward.
summary.zh: downward-curving 指“向下弯曲的”或“呈下降趋势的”。

definition.en: Curving downward; bending from a higher point toward a lower point.
definition.zh: 向下弯曲的；朝下弯的（从较高处弯向较低处）。

examples.en: The bird has a downward-curving beak for catching fish.
examples.zh: 这种鸟有向下弯曲的喙，用来捕捉鱼。

examples.en: She drew a downward-curving line to show the shape of the hill.
examples.zh: 她画了一条向下弯曲的线来表示山坡的形状。

definition.en: (Of a line or graph) Showing a decline, often suggesting a decrease over time.
definition.zh: （线条或图表）呈下弯趋势的，常表示随时间下降。

examples.en: Sales followed a downward-curving trend after the holidays.
examples.zh: 假期过后，销售额呈现下弯的下降趋势。

examples.en: The chart has a downward-curving slope in the final quarter.
examples.zh: 这张图在最后一个季度出现向下弯的斜率。

extraExplanation: “downward-curving”是复合形容词，常用连字符（hyphen）放在名词前作定语：a downward-curving branch（向下弯的树枝）。如果放在系动词后作表语，连字符有时可省略：The branch is downward curving / downward-curving（两种都可能见到，写作中更常保留连字符以清晰）。

summary.en: “Downward-cutting” describes something that cuts from higher to lower (a downward direction), especially a motion or tool action.
summary.zh: “downward-cutting”指“向下切割的”，多用于描述切割动作或工具的切削方向。

definition.en: Cutting in a direction from a higher point to a lower point (often describing a motion, tool action, or stroke).
definition.zh: 向下切割的；从高处向低处切（常描述动作、工具切削方向或刀法）。

examples.en: Use a downward-cutting motion to slice the vegetable safely.
examples.zh: 用向下切割的动作来安全地切蔬菜。

examples.en: The machine’s blade is designed for downward-cutting strokes.
examples.zh: 这台机器的刀片是为向下切削的刀程设计的。

definition.en: In computing and design: describing a process that “cuts” or reduces step by step from the top level to more detailed levels (less common; often written without a hyphen).
definition.zh: （计算机/设计语境）自上而下“裁剪/缩减”的；从高层级逐步缩小到更细层级（较少见，常不加连字符）。

examples.en: They used a downward-cutting approach to narrow the dataset.
examples.zh: 他们用自上而下的“裁剪”方法来缩小数据集。

examples.en: Start broad, then apply downward-cutting filters to refine the results.
examples.zh: 先从大范围开始，再用自上而下的筛选来细化结果。

extraExplanation: “downward-cutting”通常作复合形容词放在名词前（attributive），例如 a downward-cutting motion / blade。若放在名词后作表语，更常写成不加连字符的形式：The motion is downward cutting.
这种复合词在技术说明、操作指南里更常见；日常英语里也可以用更自然的说法：cut downward / make a downward cut。

summary.en: “Downward-directed” describes something that points, moves, or is aimed downward, literally or figuratively.
summary.zh: downward-directed 表示“向下指向/朝下移动/朝下施加”的（可作字面或引申含义）。

definition.en: Moving or pointing from a higher place to a lower place; directed downward.
definition.zh: 从高处朝低处移动或指向的；向下的。

examples.en: The sign had a downward-directed arrow showing the way to the subway.
examples.zh: 标志上有一个向下的箭头，指向地铁入口。

examples.en: Use a downward-directed force to push the lid into place.
examples.zh: 用一个向下的力把盖子按到位。

examples.en: In the diagram, the downward-directed line represents gravity.
examples.zh: 在图中，这条向下的线表示重力。

definition.en: (Figurative) Aimed at something lower in level, rank, or value; descending in status or amount.
definition.zh: （引申）朝较低层级、地位或数值方向的；下降的。

examples.en: The company reported a downward-directed trend in sales this quarter.
examples.zh: 公司报告本季度销售呈下降趋势。

examples.en: Her comments felt downward-directed, as if she were talking down to people.
examples.zh: 她的话让人感觉是在往下压人，好像在对别人居高临下。

extraExplanation: 这是一个由“downward + directed”组成的复合形容词，常用连字符（downward-directed）来表示它作为一个整体修饰名词，尤其在科技、工程、图表描述中很常见。
在学术或技术写作里，它常与“force / arrow / movement / field / vector / pressure”等名词搭配。日常口语中更常说“directed downward”或直接用“downward”。

summary.en: “Downward-flowing” describes something that flows or moves downward.
summary.zh: “downward-flowing”表示“向下流动/向下流淌的”。

definition.en: Moving or directed downward, especially in a flowing way (like water, air, or fabric).
definition.zh: 向下流动的；朝下流淌的（尤指水、空气或布料等像“流”一样移动）。

examples.en: A downward-flowing stream cut a narrow path through the rocks.
examples.zh: 一条向下流动的溪流在岩石间冲出了一条狭窄的路。

examples.en: The robe’s downward-flowing folds made the figure look taller.
examples.zh: 长袍向下流淌般的褶皱让人物看起来更高。

examples.en: Cool air from the hills formed a gentle, downward-flowing current at night.
examples.zh: 夜里山上的冷空气形成了一股轻柔的向下流动气流。

extraExplanation: “downward-flowing”是由“downward（向下的）+ flowing（流动的）”构成的连字符复合形容词，常用于名词前作定语（如：downward-flowing water/air/fabric）。在更正式或不需要强调复合形象时，也可写成“flowing downward”。
它常带有描写性、画面感，既可用于自然场景（河水、瀑布、气流），也可用于艺术与服饰描写（衣褶、头发像水一样向下垂落）。

summary.en: Downward-sloping means slanting downward; in economics, it often describes a curve that falls as it moves to the right.
summary.zh: downward-sloping 指“向下倾斜的”；在经济学中常指曲线向右时向下，表示变量间的负相关关系。

definition.en: Sloping or going down from a higher level to a lower level.
definition.zh: 向下倾斜的；从高处向低处倾斜的。

examples.en: The road is downward-sloping, so drive slowly.
examples.zh: 这条路是向下倾斜的，所以要慢点开。

examples.en: They built steps on the downward-sloping hillside.
examples.zh: 他们在向下倾斜的山坡上修了台阶。

definition.en: (Economics) Describes a line or curve that goes down as it moves to the right, often showing that one variable decreases as another increases (e.g., demand).
definition.zh: （经济学）向右移动时向下的线或曲线，常表示一个变量增加时另一个变量减少（如需求曲线）。

examples.en: A demand curve is usually downward-sloping: higher prices lead to lower quantity demanded.
examples.zh: 需求曲线通常是向下倾斜的：价格越高，需求量越低。

examples.en: The graph shows a downward-sloping relationship between interest rates and investment.
examples.zh: 这张图显示利率与投资之间存在向下倾斜的关系。

extraExplanation: 在英文写作中，downward-sloping 常用连字符（hyphen）作定语（如 a downward-sloping curve）。如果放在名词后作表语，也常见不用连字符：The curve is downward sloping.
经济学里它最常见于 demand curve（需求曲线）与 marginal benefit curve（边际收益曲线）等，强调“向右越多，纵轴越低”的形状与含义。

summary.en: “Downwardly” means ‘toward a lower position’ or ‘with eyes/head lowered (often showing emotion like shame or sadness).’
summary.zh: “downwardly”表示“朝下地”，也可指“低垂着眼睛/头（常带有羞愧、沮丧等情绪）”。

definition.en: In a way that moves or points toward a lower position or level.
definition.zh: 以向下的方式；朝较低的位置或水平。

examples.en: She looked downwardly at the map, trying to find the next street.
examples.zh: 她低头看地图，想找到下一条街。

examples.en: The road slopes downwardly after the bridge.
examples.zh: 过桥后道路向下倾斜。

definition.en: In a way that shows being unhappy, ashamed, or lacking confidence; with eyes or head lowered.
definition.zh: （神情或姿态）低垂地；显得沮丧、羞愧或缺乏自信地。

examples.en: He spoke downwardly, avoiding eye contact.
examples.zh: 他说话时低着头，避免眼神接触。

examples.en: She smiled downwardly, unsure of what to say.
examples.zh: 她低垂着眼睛笑了笑，不知该说什么。

extraExplanation: “downwardly”相对不如“downwards/downward”常用，后两者更常见于描述方向与移动（尤其是英式英语里常用downwards）。
当描述情绪或姿态时，更自然的表达通常是“look down”“cast one’s eyes down”“with eyes lowered”等；“downwardly”多出现在较正式或书面化语境。

summary.en: Downwardness means a quality or tendency of going down—either physically or in level/mood.
summary.zh: Downwardness 指“向下”的性质或趋势，可指物理上的下行，也可指水平/情绪的走低。

definition.en: the quality or state of moving or pointing downward; a downward direction or tendency
definition.zh: 向下的性质或状态；向下的方向或趋势

examples.en: The trail’s downwardness became steeper after the first mile.
examples.zh: 走完第一英里后，小路的下坡趋势变得更陡。

examples.en: The downwardness of the arrow shows where the water should flow.
examples.zh: 箭头的向下指向表示水应该往哪里流。

definition.en: a decline in level, condition, or mood (for example, in the economy or in someone’s feelings)
definition.zh: （水平、状况或情绪的）下滑、走低（如经济或心情）

examples.en: People worried about the downwardness of the job market.
examples.zh: 人们担心就业市场的下滑。

examples.en: After the argument, she felt a sudden downwardness in her mood.
examples.zh: 争吵之后，她的情绪突然低落。

extraExplanation: “downwardness”是由形容词/副词“downward”加名词后缀“-ness”构成的抽象名词，但在现代英语里不算常用；很多时候更自然的表达是“downward trend / decline / downturn / downward direction”。
在写作中使用它会显得更“文学化”或更强调“向下”这一整体感觉，但在正式报告或新闻中通常会选用更常见的词（如“decline”“downturn”）。

summary.en: Downwards means “toward a lower place” or “from higher to lower,” including direction (physical) and changes (like prices going lower).
summary.zh: Downwards 表示“向下”或“从高到低”，既可指空间方向，也可指变化趋势（如价格下跌）。

definition.en: Toward a lower place, level, or position.
definition.zh: 向下；朝较低的位置或水平。

examples.en: The elevator moved downwards to the lobby.
examples.zh: 电梯向下移动到大厅。

examples.en: Leaves drifted downwards in the wind.
examples.zh: 树叶在风中向下飘落。

definition.en: From a higher level to a lower one in order, size, value, or quality.
definition.zh: （按顺序、大小、价值或质量）从高到低；往下。

examples.en: Read the list from the top downwards.
examples.zh: 从上往下读这个列表。

examples.en: Prices have been moving downwards this month.
examples.zh: 这个月价格一直在下跌。

definition.en: Toward people or things considered lower in rank, age, or authority (often used with “from”).
definition.zh: （常与 from 连用）向（地位、年龄或权威）较低的人或群体；向下级。

examples.en: The message was passed downwards from the manager to the staff.
examples.zh: 消息从经理层层向下传达给员工。

extraExplanation: “Downwards” 与 “downward” 在美式英语里大多可以互换作副词：He looked downward/downwards. 更口语、更常见的是直接用 “down”：Look down.
英式英语中 “downwards” 更常见一些；美式英语里 “downward” 或 “down” 更常用。

summary.en: Downwarp means a downward bending or sagging of the Earth’s crust or rock layers, or the process of bending downward.
summary.zh: Downwarp 指地壳或岩层的向下弯曲/下陷（下挠），也可指使其下挠的过程。

definition.en: a downward bend or sag in the Earth’s crust or in rock layers (strata).
definition.zh: （地质）地壳或岩层向下弯曲、下陷的部位；下挠。

examples.en: The basin formed by a slow downwarp of the crust over millions of years.
examples.zh: 这个盆地是地壳在数百万年间缓慢下挠形成的。

examples.en: Geologists mapped the downwarp by studying tilted rock layers.
examples.zh: 地质学家通过研究倾斜的岩层绘制出下挠区域。

definition.en: to bend or cause something (especially rock layers) to bend downward.
definition.zh: （使）（尤指岩层）向下弯曲、下挠。

examples.en: Tectonic forces can downwarp the crust and create broad basins.
examples.zh: 构造力会使地壳下挠，形成广阔的盆地。

examples.en: Over time, the weight of sediments downwarped the underlying layers.
examples.zh: 随着时间推移，沉积物的重量使下伏地层下挠。

extraExplanation: “Downwarp”多用于地质/地理学写作，常见于“crustal downwarp（地壳下挠）”“downwarping of strata（地层下挠）”。它强调范围往往较大、过程较缓慢的“弯曲下陷”，不同于断层那种明显的“断裂错动”。

summary.en: Downwarping means a downward bending, especially of the Earth’s crust or rock layers.
summary.zh: Downwarping 指向下弯曲（下挠），尤指地壳或岩层的下挠。

definition.en: the action or process of bending or curving downward (especially layers of rock or the Earth’s crust)
definition.zh: 向下弯曲（下挠）的过程或现象（尤指岩层或地壳）

examples.en: Geologists found evidence of downwarping in the sedimentary layers near the coast.
examples.zh: 地质学家在海岸附近的沉积岩层中发现了下挠的证据。

examples.en: Over millions of years, slow downwarping created a broad basin where water could collect.
examples.zh: 经过数百万年，缓慢的下挠形成了一个宽广的盆地，水得以汇集。

definition.en: in a broader (non-technical) sense, any downward bending or sagging of a surface or structure
definition.zh: （较广义、非技术用法）任何表面或结构的向下弯曲或下陷

examples.en: The engineer checked the bridge deck for any signs of downwarping.
examples.zh: 工程师检查桥面是否有向下弯曲的迹象。

examples.en: Heat can cause slight downwarping of thin plastic panels.
examples.zh: 受热可能会使薄塑料板产生轻微的向下弯曲。

extraExplanation: “downwarping”常见于地质学语境，和“upwarping（上拱）”相对；它描述的是地壳或岩层在长期应力作用下缓慢发生的“下挠/下沉式弯曲”，常与盆地（basin）形成、沉积环境变化等话题一起出现。
词形上它来自动词“to downwarp（使向下弯曲/向下挠曲）”，但日常英语里更常见的是名词/动名词用法，技术写作中尤多。

summary.en: Downwash is the downward-moving air produced by a rotor or wing, often discussed in aviation and aerodynamics.
summary.zh: Downwash 指旋翼或机翼产生的向下气流/下洗效应，常见于航空与空气动力学语境。

definition.en: A downward flow of air pushed by a rotor or propeller (such as from a helicopter), especially near the ground.
definition.zh: 由旋翼或螺旋桨（如直升机）向下推动形成的下洗气流，尤其在接近地面时明显。

examples.en: The helicopter’s downwash kicked up dust and small stones.
examples.zh: 直升机的下洗气流卷起了尘土和小石子。

examples.en: Stay back from the landing zone because the downwash can be dangerous.
examples.zh: 请远离降落区，因为下洗气流可能很危险。

definition.en: In aerodynamics, the downward deflection of airflow behind a wing, related to lift and induced drag.
definition.zh: （空气动力学）机翼后方气流被向下偏转的现象，与升力和诱导阻力有关。

examples.en: Engineers studied the wing’s downwash to improve fuel efficiency.
examples.zh: 工程师研究机翼的下洗效应以提升燃油效率。

examples.en: Stronger lift usually creates more downwash behind the wing.
examples.zh: 更强的升力通常会在机翼后方产生更多下洗效应。

extraExplanation: “downwash”常见于航空与军警场景：例如直升机起降时会把沙尘、雪、落叶吹起，甚至影响附近人员站立与视线，因此新闻与安全提示里常出现。
词形很好记：down（向下）+ wash（冲刷/涌动），形象地表示“空气像水流一样向下冲”。

summary.en: “Downway” is a rare word meaning “downward” or “a downward path.”
summary.zh: “downway”很少见，通常表示“向下地”或“下坡的路”。

definition.en: downward; toward a lower place or level (rare/old-fashioned).
definition.zh: 向下地；朝较低处（较少见/较旧式用法）。

examples.en: The path runs downway from the village to the river.
examples.zh: 这条小路从村子向下通到河边。

examples.en: She looked downway into the valley.
examples.zh: 她朝山谷下方望去。

definition.en: a way, path, or road that goes downward (rare).
definition.zh: 下坡路；向下的道路（少见）。

examples.en: Take the downway to reach the lower fields.
examples.zh: 走下坡那条路就能到下面的田地。

extraExplanation: “downway”在现代英语里非常少见，更常用的是“downward / downhill / down the way”。如果你是在文学作品、方言材料或旧文本里看到它，通常就是“向下”或“下坡路”的意思。
如果你指的是地名或姓氏（如某些地方/家族名），那就不是普通词汇意义，需要结合具体上下文来判断。

summary.en: Downweed is an uncommon word meaning a downy (fuzzy) weed, often referring to plants like cudweed/cottonweed.
summary.zh: Downweed 是不常用词，指带绒毛的杂草，常用来指鼠麴草/棉絮草等（cudweed/cottonweed）。

definition.en: (Uncommon) A weed or wild plant with soft, downy (fuzzy) hairs on its leaves or stems; often used as a common name for plants like cudweed/cottonweed (genus *Gnaphalium* and related genera).
definition.zh: （不常用）指叶或茎带有柔软绒毛的野草/杂草；常作为某些“绒毛草”（如鼠麴草、棉絮草等，常见于 *Gnaphalium* 及近缘属）的俗名。

examples.en: In some field guides, cudweed is listed under the old common name “downweed.”
examples.zh: 在一些野外植物图鉴里，cudweed（鼠麴草/绒毛草）会被列在较旧的俗名“downweed”之下。

examples.en: The hillside was covered with downweed, its leaves looking silvery and soft.
examples.zh: 山坡上长满了downweed，叶子看起来银白而柔软。

extraExplanation: “down-”在这里表示“绒毛、茸毛”（像羽绒的细毛），不是“向下”。因此 downweed 字面意思是“带绒毛的杂草”。
downweed 不是现代英语里很常见的日常词，多见于较旧的植物俗名或地方用法。写作时如果需要更清晰，通常直接用更通行的名称（如 cudweed/cottonweed）或写出学名更准确。

summary.en: Downweigh means to give something less importance or, in statistics, to assign it a smaller weight so it influences results less.
summary.zh: Downweigh指降低某事的重要性；在统计中指给某些数据更小的权重，使其对结果影响更小。

definition.en: to give less importance, influence, or value to something; to treat it as less significant
definition.zh: 降低……的重要性/影响/价值；不太重视（某事）

examples.en: The report downweighed customer complaints, focusing mainly on profits.
examples.zh: 这份报告淡化了客户投诉，主要关注利润。

examples.en: In discussions, she tends to downweigh emotional arguments and look for evidence.
examples.zh: 在讨论中，她往往不太看重情绪化的论点，而是寻找证据。

definition.en: (statistics/data science) to assign a smaller weight to certain data points so they affect the final result less
definition.zh: （统计/数据科学）对某些数据点赋予较小权重，使其对最终结果的影响更小

examples.en: We downweighed older survey responses because the market has changed.
examples.zh: 由于市场已经变化，我们降低了较早期问卷回答的权重。

examples.en: The model downweighs outliers to reduce their impact on the average.
examples.zh: 该模型会降低离群值的权重，以减少它们对平均值的影响。

extraExplanation: “downweigh”在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的表达是“downplay（淡化）”“discount（打折扣/不太重视）”或“give less weight to…（给予较小权重）”。
在统计/机器学习语境中，“weight（权重）”指一条数据对结果的“贡献大小”；“downweigh”就是让它贡献更小，常用于处理旧数据、噪声数据或离群点（outliers）。

summary.en: Downweight means to give something less importance or a smaller weight in analysis or decision-making.
summary.zh: downweight 指在分析或决策中降低某事物的权重或重要性。

definition.en: to reduce the importance, influence, or statistical weight of something (often in analysis, ranking, or decision-making)
definition.zh: 降低（某事物）的重要性/影响力/权重（常用于统计分析、排序或决策）

examples.en: The model downweights rare outliers so they don’t distort the results.
examples.zh: 这个模型会降低罕见离群值的权重，避免它们扭曲结果。

examples.en: To make the ranking fairer, the system downweighted very old reviews.
examples.zh: 为了让排名更公平，系统降低了非常早期评论的权重。

extraExplanation: “downweight”常见于数据科学、机器学习、统计、搜索排序等语境，意思是把某个数据点/特征/信号的“贡献度”调小。对应词有“upweight”（提高权重）。
拼写上也常见作“down-weight”（带连字符），尤其在学术写作中。
与“ignore”不同：downweight通常不是完全不看，而是“仍然考虑，但影响更小”。

summary.en: Downweighted means given less importance or assigned a smaller weight so it influences the result less.
summary.zh: Downweighted 指被降低重要性，或被赋予较小权重，从而对结果影响更小。

definition.en: given less importance, influence, or priority than something else
definition.zh: 被降低重要性/影响力；被赋予较低权重（不如其他事物重要）

examples.en: In the final decision, customer complaints were downweighted because the sample was small.
examples.zh: 在最终决定中，由于样本较小，客户投诉的重要性被下调了。

examples.en: Her early experience was downweighted compared with her recent performance.
examples.zh: 与她近期的表现相比，她早期的经验被看得没那么重要。

definition.en: (statistics / data / machine learning) assigned a smaller numerical weight so it affects a result less
definition.zh: （统计/数据/机器学习）被分配较小的数值权重，从而对结果影响更小

examples.en: Outliers are often downweighted so they don’t distort the average.
examples.zh: 异常值常被降低权重，以免扭曲平均值。

examples.en: The model downweighted frequent words like “the” and “and.”
examples.zh: 模型会降低像“the”“and”这类高频词的权重。

extraExplanation: “downweighted”通常是动词“downweight”的过去分词/形容词用法，常见于学术写作、报告和数据分析语境。
在统计与机器学习里，downweight 与 upweight（提高权重）相对；常见搭配有 downweighted data / downweighted observations / downweighted features。

summary.en: Downwelling is the downward movement of water or air, especially discussed in oceanography and meteorology.
summary.zh: Downwelling 指水体或空气的下沉运动，常见于海洋学与气象学语境。

definition.en: (Oceanography/meteorology) The downward movement of water or air, often caused by wind patterns, pressure systems, or convergence at the surface.
definition.zh: （海洋学/气象学）水体或空气向下的运动，常由风场、气压系统或表层汇聚等造成。

examples.en: Coastal downwelling can push warm surface water downward and reduce nutrient supply near the surface.
examples.zh: 沿海下沉（downwelling）会把较暖的表层海水压向下方，从而减少表层的营养盐补给。

examples.en: A strong high-pressure system often leads to downwelling in the atmosphere.
examples.zh: 强盛的高压系统常会导致大气下沉。

extraExplanation: 在海洋学里，downwelling 常与 upwelling（上升流）对比：上升流把深层富营养的冷水带到表面，利于浮游生物与渔业；下沉则更可能把表层水“压下去”，使表层营养盐变少。
在沿岸地区，当风把表层海水推向岸边时，海水会在岸边“堆积并下沉”，这就是典型的 coastal downwelling（沿岸下沉）。
在气象学语境中，downwelling/ subsidence（下沉）常与晴朗少云相关：空气下沉会增温变干，从而抑制云和降水。

summary.en: Downwind means “in/at the direction the wind is blowing toward.”
summary.zh: downwind 表示“在/向下风方向（风吹去的方向）”。

definition.en: in the direction the wind is blowing; toward the place the wind is carrying air, smoke, smells, etc.
definition.zh: 顺风方向；沿着风吹去的方向（气味、烟等被风带去的方向）

examples.en: The smoke drifted downwind and bothered the neighbors.
examples.zh: 烟顺风飘过去，影响了邻居。

examples.en: Set up camp downwind so the smell doesn’t blow toward the trail.
examples.zh: 把营地搭在下风处，这样气味就不会吹到步道那边。

definition.en: located in the direction the wind is blowing (on the leeward side).
definition.zh: 在下风处的；位于顺风方向的（背风一侧的）

examples.en: There’s a small village downwind of the factory.
examples.zh: 工厂下风处有个小村庄。

examples.en: Downwind areas may experience stronger odors.
examples.zh: 下风区域可能会闻到更明显的气味。

extraExplanation: “downwind”常与“upwind（上风处）”成对使用：upwind 指风吹来的方向，downwind 指风吹去的方向。找方向的小技巧：把自己想成风里的树叶，叶子飘去的方向就是 downwind。

summary.en: Downwind-rigged describes something (especially a sailboat) set up to perform best with the wind behind it; it can also mean “arranged to have an unfair or easy advantage.”
summary.zh: downwind-rigged 指（尤指帆船）为顺风航行而装配/调整的；也可比喻为“被安排得占尽优势、很容易赢”的。

definition.en: (Nautical) Rigged or set up so a boat or sail works best when the wind is behind it (sailing with the wind).
definition.zh: （航海）按顺风航行来装配或调整的；使船或帆在风从后方吹来时效率最佳的。

examples.en: A downwind-rigged sailboat feels fast and stable when the breeze is at its back.
examples.zh: 顺风装配的帆船在风从背后吹来时会感觉又快又稳。

examples.en: They chose a downwind-rigged setup for the long leg across open water.
examples.zh: 他们为跨越开阔水域的长航段选择了顺风装配的配置。

definition.en: (Figurative) Arranged to take advantage of favorable conditions; “set up for an easy win.”
definition.zh: （比喻）安排得占尽有利条件的；“顺风顺水、容易取胜”的。

examples.en: With a strong team and no real rivals, the campaign looked downwind-rigged from the start.
examples.zh: 团队强大又几乎没有对手，这场竞选从一开始就像是占尽优势、顺风装配好的。

examples.en: Some critics said the deal was downwind-rigged to favor the larger company.
examples.zh: 一些批评者说这笔交易被设计得偏向大公司，简直是占尽优势。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较少见的复合形容词，常见于航海/帆船语境：downwind 表示“顺风（风从后方来）”，rigged 来自 rig（装配、布置帆具/索具）。
写作上常用连字符 downwind-rigged 来修饰名词（如 downwind-rigged boat/setup）。也可写作 downwind rigged（不太常见），但连字符更清晰。
与之相关的常见对比是 upwind（逆风）/ close-hauled（迎风紧靠风向航行）。顺风装配通常强调在“风在后方”时更省力或更快，但未必适合所有风向。

summary.en: “Down with” can be a protest slogan meaning “end/remove,” and in informal speech it can mean “sick with” or “support/agree with.”
summary.zh: “Down with” 既可作抗议口号（表示“打倒/取消”），也可在口语中表示“患病”或“支持/认同”。

definition.en: Used as a shout or slogan to show strong opposition and demand that someone or something should be ended or removed.
definition.zh: （口号/喊话）表示强烈反对，要求推翻、终止或取消某人/某事。

examples.en: Down with corruption!
examples.zh: 打倒腐败！

examples.en: The crowd shouted, “Down with the dictator!”
examples.zh: 人群高喊：“打倒独裁者！”

definition.en: (informal) To be sick with an illness.
definition.zh: （非正式）患（某种病），病倒。

examples.en: I’m down with a bad cold, so I’m staying home.
examples.zh: 我得了重感冒，所以待在家里。

examples.en: Half the office is down with the flu this week.
examples.zh: 这周办公室有一半的人都得了流感。

definition.en: (slang) To like, support, or understand something; to be in agreement with it.
definition.zh: （俚语）喜欢/支持/认同；懂、跟得上（某事）。

examples.en: I’m down with that plan.
examples.zh: 我赞同那个计划。

examples.en: She’s not really down with the new rules.
examples.zh: 她其实并不太认同新规定。

extraExplanation: “Down with …!” 常见于抗议、运动或演讲中的口号，语气很强，带有“推翻/铲除”的感觉；正式写作中要谨慎使用。
“be down with + illness” 是英式与美式都常见的口语说法；更中性也可以说 “have the flu / have a cold”。
“be down with (something)” 作为俚语在流行文化、音乐语境中更常见，表示“很买账/很认同/很懂”。

summary.en: Downy means soft and covered with fine fuzz or down feathers; it can also mean the fuzz/down itself.
summary.zh: downy 指“柔软、带细绒毛/绒羽的”，也可指“绒毛/绒羽本身”。

definition.en: Covered with soft, fine hairs or a very light, soft layer (like feathers).
definition.zh: 覆盖着柔软细小的绒毛的；（像羽绒一样）轻软的。

examples.en: The peach skin feels downy and soft.
examples.zh: 桃子的表皮摸起来有细绒毛，很柔软。

examples.en: The baby bird is still downy, not fully feathered yet.
examples.zh: 这只雏鸟身上还是绒绒的，还没长出完整的羽毛。

definition.en: Fine soft hair, fuzz, or the soft under-feathers of a bird.
definition.zh: 细软的绒毛；（鸟的）绒羽。

examples.en: A little downy fuzz covered the kitten’s ears.
examples.zh: 小猫的耳朵上覆着一层细细的绒毛。

examples.en: The jacket is filled with downy feathers to keep you warm.
examples.zh: 这件外套填充了绒羽来保暖。

extraExplanation: “down”在英文里既可指“向下”，也可指“绒羽/绒毛”。“downy”来自“down（绒羽）+ -y（……的）”，所以主要意思是“有绒毛的、柔软的”。
在日常生活中，“downy”也常让人联想到美国的衣物柔顺剂品牌 Downy（宝洁旗下）。但作为词汇本身，它并不专指品牌。

summary.en: Describes a plant whose fruit is covered with fine, soft hairs.
summary.zh: 形容植物的果实表面覆有细软绒毛。

definition.en: (Botany) Having fruit covered with fine, soft hairs; fuzzy- or pubescent-fruited.
definition.zh: （植物学）果实表面覆有细软绒毛的；“有绒毛果”的。

examples.en: The plant is described as downy-fruited, which helps you identify it in the field.
examples.zh: 这种植物被描述为 downy-fruited（果实有绒毛），这有助于你在野外辨认它。

examples.en: Downy-fruited varieties often feel slightly velvety when the fruit is young.
examples.zh: downy-fruited 的品种在果实幼嫩时摸起来常常有一点天鹅绒般的触感。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较专业的形容词，多见于植物志、物种鉴定手册或学术描述中，用来概括“果实表面有细毛/绒毛”的形态特征。
downy 在日常英语里也可形容“覆盖柔软绒毛的”（如 downy feathers 绒羽），放在这里强调毛细、柔软而密的触感；与 hairy-fruited（毛更粗更明显）或 pubescent-fruited（更学术、更中性）在语气上略有差别。

summary.en: Downy-leaved describes plants whose leaves are covered with soft, fine hairs.
summary.zh: downy-leaved 指叶片覆盖细软绒毛的植物（柔毛叶）。

definition.en: (Botany) Having leaves covered with fine, soft hairs, giving them a fuzzy or velvety feel.
definition.zh: （植物）叶子表面覆盖细软绒毛的；叶片呈绒毛状/柔毛状的。

examples.en: The downy-leaved plant feels soft when you touch its leaves.
examples.zh: 这种柔毛叶植物的叶子摸起来很柔软。

examples.en: Downy-leaved herbs often look slightly gray-green because of the tiny hairs.
examples.zh: 柔毛叶草本植物常因细小绒毛而呈现略灰绿的颜色。

examples.en: In dry habitats, many shrubs are downy-leaved to reduce water loss.
examples.zh: 在干燥环境中，许多灌木长柔毛叶以减少水分流失。

extraExplanation: 这是一个常见的植物学复合形容词：downy（有绒毛的、柔软的）+ leaved（有……叶子的）。在植物描述中，用来强调叶片表面的“细毛/绒毛（trichomes）”，这些细毛可能帮助植物减少蒸腾、反射强光或抵御昆虫。
相关近义描述还包括：hairy-leaved（多毛叶的，较笼统）、fuzzy-leaved（毛茸茸的，偏口语）、velvety-leaved（天鹅绒般的，强调触感）。

summary.en: “Downy-mildew-related” means connected with or caused by the plant disease downy mildew.
summary.zh: “downy-mildew-related”指与植物病害“霜霉病”有关或由其引起的。

definition.en: Related to or caused by downy mildew (a group of plant diseases caused by oomycetes, leading to pale spots on leaves and fuzzy growth, especially in humid conditions).
definition.zh: 与霜霉病有关的；由霜霉病引起的（霜霉病是一类由卵菌类致病生物引起的植物病害，常在潮湿环境下导致叶片出现淡色斑点和绒毛状霉层）。

examples.en: The farmer sprayed a fungicide after noticing downy-mildew-related spots on the cucumber leaves.
examples.zh: 农民在发现黄瓜叶片上出现霜霉病相关斑点后，喷施了杀菌剂。

examples.en: We removed the downy-mildew-related leaves to reduce the spread in the greenhouse.
examples.zh: 我们把霜霉病相关的病叶摘除，以减少其在温室中的传播。

examples.en: The report lists downy-mildew-related losses as the main reason for the lower grape yield this year.
examples.zh: 报告指出，今年葡萄减产的主要原因是霜霉病相关损失。

extraExplanation: “downy mildew（霜霉病）”常见于葡萄、黄瓜、莴苣、罗勒等作物，偏好凉爽潮湿环境；“downy-mildew-related”多用于农业、园艺、植物病理等语境。
注意区分“downy mildew（霜霉）”与“powdery mildew（白粉病）”：两者症状和防治方式可能不同；霜霉常在叶背出现灰白到紫灰色的绒毛状霉层。
写作上该词通常作复合形容词，常见搭配有：downy-mildew-related damage/symptoms/infection/losses（霜霉病相关的损害/症状/感染/损失）。

summary.en: Downy-petaled describes flowers whose petals are very soft and fluffy-looking.
summary.zh: downy-petaled 形容花瓣绒软、蓬松、像绒毛一样细柔。

definition.en: Having petals that look or feel soft and fluffy, like fine feathers (often used in poetry or descriptive writing).
definition.zh: （花瓣）像绒毛一样柔软、蓬松的（常用于诗意或描写性的文字）。

examples.en: She picked a downy-petaled rose and held it gently.
examples.zh: 她摘下一朵花瓣绒软的玫瑰，轻轻捧在手里。

examples.en: The downy-petaled peony opened slowly in the morning light.
examples.zh: 花瓣绒柔的牡丹在晨光里慢慢绽放。

extraExplanation: “downy”来自名词“down”（绒毛、羽绒），常用来形容像雏鸟细羽或天鹅绒那样细软的触感；放在描写花时，会带出一种温柔、细腻、带触觉的画面感。
“downy-petaled”是复合形容词（形容词+过去分词/形容词化的分词），用连字符把两个部分连起来，常见于文学或自然描写中，比单说“soft petals”更有意境。

summary.en: “Downzone” means to rezone land for less intensive development (lower density or height).
summary.zh: “Downzone”指把土地重新划为开发强度更低的分区（降低密度或高度等）。

definition.en: (Urban planning) To change the zoning of an area to allow less intensive use, usually lower building height or lower housing density.
definition.zh: （城市规划）将某片地区“降级分区/降低容积率”，使其只能进行强度更低的开发或用途（通常是更低建筑高度或更低居住密度）。

examples.en: The city voted to downzone the waterfront to protect the view and reduce traffic.
examples.zh: 市政府投票决定对滨水区进行降级分区，以保护景观并减少交通压力。

examples.en: Neighbors asked officials to downzone the block from apartments to single-family homes.
examples.zh: 邻居们请求官员把这条街区从公寓用地降级为独栋住宅用地。

extraExplanation: “Downzone”常见于美国/加拿大等地的土地使用与城市规划语境。它通常指政府通过修改分区条例（zoning ordinance），把某地从更“高强度”的允许范围改为更“低强度”（例如从多户住宅改为独栋、从高层改为低层、降低容积率或减少可建面积）。
它常与公共利益目标相关（如控制拥堵、保护历史街区、保持社区风貌），但也可能引发争议：支持者认为能保护环境与居住品质，反对者可能认为会减少住房供应、推高房价。
相关对比词：upzone（提高开发强度/提高密度）、rezone（重新划分用途，不一定升或降）。

summary.en: Downzoning is lowering the allowed size, density, or intensity of development on land by changing zoning rules.
summary.zh: Downzoning 指通过修改分区规定，降低土地可开发的规模、密度或用途强度。

definition.en: a change in zoning rules that reduces what can be built on a piece of land (for example, allowing fewer homes, shorter buildings, or only less intensive uses).
definition.zh: （城市规划中的）降密分区；下调分区：通过修改土地分区规定，降低某地块可开发的强度（如更少住房、更矮建筑或更低强度用途）。

examples.en: Residents opposed the proposed downzoning because it would limit new housing near the subway.
examples.zh: 居民反对拟议的降密分区，因为这会限制地铁附近的新住房建设。

examples.en: The city approved downzoning in the waterfront area to protect views and reduce traffic.
examples.zh: 市政府批准对滨水区降密分区，以保护景观视野并减少交通压力。

definition.en: to reduce the allowed development intensity of land by changing zoning regulations.
definition.zh: 对（土地）进行降密分区；下调分区：通过调整分区法规来降低允许的开发强度。

examples.en: The council voted to downzone several blocks from mixed-use to low-density residential.
examples.zh: 议会投票决定将若干街区从混合用途下调为低密度住宅用地。

examples.en: Some activists argue the city shouldn’t downzone areas where rents are rising fast.
examples.zh: 一些活动人士认为，在租金快速上涨的地区，城市不应进行降密分区。

extraExplanation: “Downzoning”常见于美国城市规划与房地产语境，尤其在纽约、洛杉矶等大城市的社区听证与媒体报道中。它通常与住房供给、房价/租金、社区“保护”与“增长”之间的争论相关。
它的核心是“减少可建规模/密度”，可能体现在降低容积率（FAR）、限高、减少可建住宅套数，或把允许用途从商住混合改为纯住宅/更低强度用途。
相关对立概念是“upzoning（升密/提高开发强度）”。在公共讨论里，有时也会出现带价值判断的说法，如“anti-development downzoning（反开发的降密）”或“contextual downzoning（情境式/保护性降密）”。

summary.en: “dowp” isn’t a standard English word; it’s likely a typo or context-specific abbreviation.
summary.zh: “dowp”不是标准英语单词；更可能是拼写错误或特定语境下的缩写。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is most likely a typo or a shortened form you saw in a specific context (chat, gaming, a name, or a brand).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。很可能是拼写错误，或是在特定语境（聊天、游戏、姓名、品牌等）中的缩写/写法。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “dowp” in a dictionary—did you mean “down” or “dope”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“dowp”——你是想写“down”还是“dope”？

examples.en: Can you share the full sentence where you saw “dowp”?
examples.zh: 你能把包含“dowp”的完整句子发我吗？

extraExplanation:
“dowp”在常见英语词典中通常查不到。最有效的做法是看它出现的上下文：
- 如果是打字失误：常见可能是 down / drop / dope / do wp（在技术或游戏里也可能有特殊含义）。
- 如果来自某个平台/圈子：可能是内部缩写、用户名、地名或品牌写法。
把原句贴出来，我可以根据语境判断你真正想要的词，并给出正确拼写、发音和用法。

summary.en: A dowress is a woman associated with a dowry or (historically) a widow legally entitled to part of her husband’s estate.
summary.zh: dowress 指与嫁妆相关的女子；也可指（历史上）依法享有亡夫部分遗产份额的寡妇。

definition.en: A woman who receives and holds a dowry (property or money brought by a bride), especially one who later becomes entitled to keep it as her own.
definition.zh: （尤指在传统婚姻制度中）带着并拥有嫁妆的女子；（后来）有权保有嫁妆的女人。

examples.en: In the novel, she is described as a wealthy dowress whose land made her a desirable match.
examples.zh: 在小说里，她被描写成一位富有的带妆女子，她的土地让她成了理想的婚配对象。

examples.en: The dowress kept the jewelry in her own name after the marriage.
examples.zh: 婚后，这位带妆女子把珠宝登记在自己名下。

definition.en: A widow who is entitled to a dower (a legal right to part of her late husband’s estate).
definition.zh: 有权享有“寡妇产/夫产份额”（dower）的寡妇。

examples.en: Under older laws, a dowress could claim a portion of her husband’s property.
examples.zh: 在较早的法律制度下，寡妇可以主张获得丈夫财产的一部分。

examples.en: The estate records listed her as the dowress with rights to the manor house.
examples.zh: 地产档案中把她列为“享有夫产份额的寡妇”，并注明她对庄园宅邸有权利。

extraExplanation: “dowress”主要见于历史、法律或文学语境，现代日常英语很少使用。它与“dowry（嫁妆）”相关，但也常与“dower（寡妇对亡夫遗产的法定份额）”混用或并存，具体含义需看上下文。
在英美文学里，这个词常用于刻画财富与婚姻策略（例如以财产决定婚配的社会）。阅读时可留意它往往带有阶层与家产继承制度的时代背景。

summary.en: “Dowries” means the plural of “dowry”: property or money given by a bride or her family at marriage.
summary.zh: “dowries”是“dowry”的复数：指结婚时女方或女方家庭带给男方的财物（嫁妆）。

definition.en: Plural of dowry: money, property, or valuable goods that a bride (or her family) gives to the groom or the groom’s family at marriage.
definition.zh: dowry 的复数：指新娘（或新娘家庭）在婚姻中带给新郎或新郎家庭的金钱、财产或贵重物品（嫁妆）。

examples.en: In some historical records, dowries included land, jewelry, and household items.
examples.zh: 在一些历史记载中，嫁妆包括土地、首饰和家用物品。

examples.en: Her parents saved for years to provide dowries for their daughters.
examples.zh: 她的父母存了很多年钱，为女儿们准备嫁妆。

extraExplanation: “dowry（嫁妆）”常见于历史或特定文化语境中，现代英语新闻里也会出现在讨论性别平等、婚姻习俗或相关社会问题时。
注意区分：dowry（嫁妆）是女方家庭给男方；bride price / bridewealth（彩礼、聘礼）通常是男方给女方家庭。不同地区与时代的做法差异很大。

summary.en: A dowry is money or property a bride’s family gives at marriage, traditionally to the groom or his family.
summary.zh: dowry 指嫁妆：结婚时新娘家传统上给新郎或其家庭的钱财或财物。

definition.en: Money, property, or valuable goods that a bride’s family gives to the groom or his family when she gets married (in some cultures and historical periods).
definition.zh: （某些文化或历史时期中）新娘家在结婚时给新郎或新郎家的钱财、财物或贵重物品（嫁妆）。

examples.en: In some countries, the dowry can include cash, jewelry, or land.
examples.zh: 在一些国家，嫁妆可能包括现金、珠宝或土地。

examples.en: The novel describes how a woman’s dowry affected her chances of marriage.
examples.zh: 这部小说描写了女性的嫁妆如何影响她的婚姻机会。

definition.en: A married woman’s property or money brought to her husband (older or legal/historical use).
definition.zh: （较旧或法律/历史用法）已婚女性带到丈夫家的财产或金钱。

examples.en: The contract listed the dowry and how it would be managed.
examples.zh: 契约列出了嫁妆及其管理方式。

extraExplanation: “dowry”在不同文化中的含义与做法差异很大，有的地区是传统习俗，有的地区因可能引发经济压力与社会问题而受到法律限制或禁止。学习时可与“bride price / bridewealth（彩礼/聘礼）”区分：dowry通常是女方给男方（或新家庭），而bride price通常是男方给女方家庭。
文学作品中常见于讨论婚姻与阶级/经济的主题，例如简·奥斯汀时代的英国社会背景里，财产与婚姻安排密切相关，相关情节常用来反映女性处境与社会结构。

summary.en: A dowry-holder is someone who holds or manages a dowry (marriage property).
summary.zh: dowry-holder 指持有或管理嫁妆（婚姻财产）的人。

definition.en: a person who possesses, controls, or is legally responsible for a dowry (money, property, or goods given at marriage).
definition.zh: 持有、掌控或在法律上负责管理“嫁妆/妆奁”（结婚时随嫁的金钱、财物或物品）的人。

examples.en: After the wedding, her uncle acted as the dowry-holder until she turned 21.
examples.zh: 婚礼之后，她的叔叔一直作为嫁妆持有人代为管理，直到她21岁。

examples.en: The court asked the dowry-holder to provide records of the jewelry and land.
examples.zh: 法院要求嫁妆持有人提供珠宝和土地的记录。

extraExplanation: “dowry-holder”不是非常常见的现代英语词，更常见的说法是“holder of the dowry”“trustee (of the dowry)”或更具体的法律/财产术语。它通常出现在历史叙述、家庭财产安排、或涉及嫁妆归属与管理的语境中。
“dowry（嫁妆）”在不同文化与时代含义不尽相同：在一些地区是女方家庭提供给新家庭/新郎家庭的财物；在另一些法律体系里更像是给新娘的财产保障。理解文本时要结合具体国家、宗教与法律背景。

summary.en: “Dowry-related” means connected with a dowry or issues involving dowries.
summary.zh: “dowry-related”表示“与嫁妆有关的；涉及嫁妆问题的”。

definition.en: Connected with a dowry (money, property, or goods a bride’s family gives to the groom or the groom’s family at marriage).
definition.zh: 与嫁妆有关的（嫁妆指新娘家庭在婚姻中给新郎或新郎家庭的金钱、财产或物品）。

examples.en: The novel explores dowry-related pressure on young couples.
examples.zh: 这部小说探讨了与嫁妆有关的压力如何影响年轻夫妻。

examples.en: She works with a nonprofit that helps victims of dowry-related abuse.
examples.zh: 她在一家非营利组织工作，帮助遭受与嫁妆有关的虐待的受害者。

examples.en: The government announced stricter penalties for dowry-related crimes.
examples.zh: 政府宣布对与嫁妆有关的犯罪采取更严厉的处罚。

extraExplanation: “dowry-related”常用于新闻、法律与社会议题语境，尤其在讨论某些地区仍存在的“索取嫁妆”、由此引发的家庭冲突、暴力或经济压力时会出现。由于不同文化对婚姻赠礼（如嫁妆、聘礼）理解不同，使用时要注意语境与措辞的中立性。

summary.en: “Dowryless” means having no dowry; it’s most often seen in historical or literary contexts.
summary.zh: “dowryless”意为“没有嫁妆的”，多用于历史或文学语境。

definition.en: Without a dowry (money, property, or goods brought by a bride to a marriage).
definition.zh: 没有嫁妆的；不带嫁妆的（指新娘在婚姻中未带来金钱、财产或物品）。

examples.en: In some older novels, a dowryless daughter is portrayed as having fewer marriage prospects.
examples.zh: 在一些较早的小说里，没有嫁妆的女儿常被描写为婚姻机会更少。

examples.en: She was described as dowryless, but her education and character were highly valued.
examples.zh: 她被描述为没有嫁妆，但她的教育和品格却很受重视。

extraExplanation: “dowryless”多见于文学或历史语境，用来强调传统婚姻制度下的经济条件与女性处境，现代日常英语里并不常用；更常见的表达是“without a dowry”。
“dowry（嫁妆）”在不同文化中含义与习俗差异很大：有的社会由女方家庭提供嫁妆，有的则是男方家庭提供“bride price（聘礼/彩礼）”。阅读作品时要结合具体时代与地区理解。

summary.en: “Dows” means “searches (by dowsing),” the third-person singular form of “dowse.”
summary.zh: “Dows”意为“（用探水术）寻找/探测”，是动词“dowse”的第三人称单数形式。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “dowse”) to search for underground water, minerals, etc. using a forked stick or special rods; sometimes used more generally to mean “to find something by intuition.”
definition.zh: （动词 dowse 的第三人称单数）用“探水杖/探测杆”寻找地下水、矿脉等；也可引申为“凭直觉探查、寻找”。

examples.en: He dows for water on rural farmland.
examples.zh: 他在乡村农地里用探水杖找地下水。

examples.en: Some people claim she dows missing objects just by holding a pendulum.
examples.zh: 有些人说她只要拿着摆锤就能“凭直觉”找到丢失的东西。

extraExplanation: “Dows”通常出现在谈论“dowsing（探水术/占测术）”时。很多国家与科学界普遍认为探水术缺乏可靠的科学证据，更接近民俗信仰或伪科学；在阅读或写作中常带有怀疑、传闻或民间色彩。
拼写提示：动词原形是 dowse（/daʊz/），名词常见形式是 dowsing。

summary.en: “dows” usually means “searches for water/minerals by dowsing; tries to find by intuition.”
summary.zh: “dows”通常指“用探水术找地下水/矿物；凭直觉寻找”。

definition.en: (third-person singular of dowse) to search for underground water, minerals, etc. using a “dowsing rod,” or to try to find something by intuition.
definition.zh: （dowse 的第三人称单数）用“探水杖/占水杖”寻找地下水、矿物等；也可指凭直觉去寻找某物。

examples.en: He dows for water on rural land with a forked stick.
examples.zh: 他用一根分叉的木棍在乡下土地上探水。

examples.en: Some people claim she dows missing objects just by holding a pendulum.
examples.zh: 有些人说她只要拿着摆锤就能“探测”丢失的东西。

extraExplanation: “dows”通常来自动词“dowse”（/daʊz/），意思与“dowsing（探水术）”有关。这是一种民间做法，常见说法是用分叉树枝或金属杆寻找地下水；科学界普遍认为缺乏可靠证据。
注意不要和“douse”混淆：douse（/daʊs/）更常见，意思是“把火/灯浇灭；把某人泼湿”。两者拼写和读音相近，但含义不同。

summary.en: Dowsabel is an old-fashioned literary female name, often linked with the idea of “sweet and beautiful.”
summary.zh: Dowsabel 是一种带古风的文学女性名字，常与“甜美、美丽”的意象相关。

definition.en: a female name used in older English literature and ballads, especially as the name of a beautiful young woman
definition.zh: （旧时英语文学/民谣中出现的）女性名字，常用来指一位美丽的年轻女子（如人物名）

examples.en: In the old ballad, Dowsabel is praised for her beauty and grace.
examples.zh: 在那首古老的民谣里，Dowsabel 因美貌与优雅而被称赞。

examples.en: The poet chose the name Dowsabel to give the character a medieval, romantic feel.
examples.zh: 诗人选用 Dowsabel 这个名字，是为了让角色带有中世纪的浪漫气息。

extraExplanation: “Dowsabel”多被认为来源于法语短语“douce et belle”（意为“甜美而美丽”），在英语里经过音变后写成一个女性名字。
它最常见于英国民谣与通俗叙事诗传统，例如常被提到的《Dowsabel》（常归于16世纪作家 Thomas Deloney 的作品传统），因此现代英语日常对话里几乎不会用到，更像是文学/历史氛围的名字。

summary.en: “dowsabels” is not a recognized English word; it’s probably a typo or a proper name.
summary.zh: “dowsabels”不是常见英语词，可能是拼写错误或专有名词（如名字/用户名）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling or a name/username.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词，可能是拼写错误，或是人名/用户名。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “dowsabels” in an English dictionary—did you mean “dowse,” “labels,” or “Dozables”?
examples.zh: 我在英语词典里找不到“dowsabels”——你是不是想写“dowse（探水/占卜找水）”、“labels（标签）”，或其他拼法？

extraExplanation:
你可以告诉我：
1）这是你在哪儿看到的（句子/截图/链接）？
2）你想表达的中文意思是什么？

根据拼写，它可能接近：
- dowse /daʊz/：用“探水杖”找地下水（也可引申为“探寻”）。
- labels：标签、标注（复数）。
- dowsable（较少见）：可用探水术探测的（形容词）。

把原句发我，我可以帮你精准判断并给出释义与例句。

summary.en: Dowse means to search for underground water (traditionally using a rod), and it can also mean to hunt carefully for something difficult to find.
summary.zh: Dowse 指用传统“探水法”寻找地下水等隐藏之物，也可引申为仔细搜寻难以找到的事物或信息。

definition.en: to search for underground water, minerals, or other hidden things using a special stick or rod (a traditional method called dowsing)
definition.zh: 用“探水杖/占水杖”等工具寻找地下水、矿物或其他隐藏之物（传统方法，称为“探水/占卜式找水”）

examples.en: Some farmers still dowse for water before digging a new well.
examples.zh: 有些农民在打新井前仍会用探水法寻找水源。

examples.en: They hired someone to dowse the land for a possible spring.
examples.zh: 他们雇人用探水法在这块地上寻找可能的泉眼。

definition.en: (figurative) to search carefully for information or something hard to find
definition.zh: （比喻）细致地搜寻信息或难以找到的东西

examples.en: The journalist dowsed the archives for clues about the old scandal.
examples.zh: 那位记者在档案里细细搜寻关于旧丑闻的线索。

examples.en: She spent the weekend dowsing for the best flight deals online.
examples.zh: 她周末在网上到处搜寻最划算的机票。

extraExplanation: “Dowse”常与名词“dowsing（探水/占水）”“divining rod（占卜杖/探水杖）”一起出现。这种做法在民间传统中很常见，但在现代科学界通常被认为缺乏可靠证据支持，因此更常在历史、民俗或带点神秘色彩的语境中见到。
拼写提示：更常见的动词是“douse”（如“douse a fire”=把火浇灭）。而“dowse”主要与“dowsing（探水）”相关；在少数旧用法里也可能被当作“douse”的变体，但不常见。

summary.en: “Dowsed” is the past form of “dowse,” meaning either (1) to search for underground water by divining, or (2) more generally to discover something hidden; it can also mean to drench/splash with liquid in some contexts.
summary.zh: “dowsed”是“dowse”的过去式/过去分词，常指（1）用探水杖等方法寻找地下水；也可泛指（2）发现隐藏之物；在某些语境下还可表示（3）泼湿/浇灭。

definition.en: to search for underground water, minerals, or other hidden things using a “divining rod” (a traditional, non-scientific method); past tense/past participle of “dowse.”
definition.zh: 用“探水杖/占卜杖”寻找地下水、矿物或其他隐藏物（传统但缺乏科学依据的方法）；“dowse”的过去式/过去分词。

examples.en: They dowsed the field to find a spot for a new well.
examples.zh: 他们在田里用探水的方法找一处适合打新井的位置。

examples.en: The farmer said he had dowsed water here years ago.
examples.zh: 那位农民说他多年前就在这里探到过水。

definition.en: to discover or locate something hidden (used more generally, sometimes humorously); past tense/past participle of “dowse.”
definition.zh: （更泛指、有时带点幽默）发现或找到隐藏的东西；“dowse”的过去式/过去分词。

examples.en: She dowsed out the best deals by comparing prices online.
examples.zh: 她通过线上比价“探”出了最划算的优惠。

examples.en: The reporter dowsed the truth from old records.
examples.zh: 记者从旧档案里挖出了真相。

definition.en: to drench or splash with liquid; also (older usage) to put out (a fire) with water; past tense/past participle of “dowse.”
definition.zh: 用液体浸湿、泼湿；也可指（较旧用法）用水把火浇灭；“dowse”的过去式/过去分词。

examples.en: A wave dowsed everyone on the front of the boat.
examples.zh: 一个浪头把船头的人都淋透了。

examples.en: He dowsed the fire with a bucket of water.
examples.zh: 他提了一桶水把火浇灭了。

extraExplanation: “Dowsing（探水/探矿）”在英语文化里常见于乡村或民间故事：人们手持分叉树枝或金属杆，走动时看杆是否“自动”偏转来判断地下是否有水。它在民俗中很有名，但在现代科学检验中通常被认为缺乏可靠证据。
小提醒：更常见的拼写是动词原形“dowse”，过去式/过去分词是“dowsed”。有些人会把“douse（浇、淋）”和“dowse（探水/也可指浇灭）”混淆，写作时要看语境。

summary.en: A dowser is someone who uses dowsing rods (or similar tools) to look for underground water or other hidden things; it can also mean to do that activity.
summary.zh: dowser 指用探测杆等工具寻找地下水或隐藏物的人；也可作动词表示进行探水术/占测。

definition.en: A person who searches for underground water, minerals, or other hidden things—traditionally using a forked stick or bent metal rods (dowsing rods).
definition.zh: 探水者；寻矿者（传统上用“探水杖/探测杆”等工具寻找地下水、矿物或其他隐藏物）。

examples.en: In the old stories, a dowser would walk across a field holding a forked branch to find water.
examples.zh: 在老故事里，探水者会拿着一根Y形树枝走过田地来寻找水源。

examples.en: Some farmers still hire a dowser before digging a new well.
examples.zh: 有些农场主在打新井前仍会请探水者来帮忙。

definition.en: To search for underground water or hidden objects by using dowsing rods or similar methods; to do dowsing.
definition.zh: 用探测杆等方法“探测”地下水或隐藏物；进行占测（探水术）。

examples.en: They tried dowsing for water, but the well location was chosen mainly by geological surveys.
examples.zh: 他们试着用探水术找水，但井位主要还是根据地质勘测来定的。

examples.en: She learned to dowse from her grandfather, who believed the rods could sense water.
examples.zh: 她跟祖父学会了探水，他相信探测杆能感应到水。

extraExplanation: “Dowsing”在英语里也常叫“water divining”或“water witching”。在欧美民间传统中，它曾被当作找水、找矿的方法，但在现代科学研究中通常缺乏可靠证据支持，因此多被视为民俗信仰或伪科学。
词源上与动词“dowse”（把东西浸入水中/突然落下）有关，后来引申出“寻找水源”的含义。

summary.en: Dowsers are people who practice dowsing—trying to find underground water or hidden things using rods or a pendulum.
summary.zh: Dowsers 指进行 dowsing 的人：用探测杆或摆锤等方式寻找地下水或隐藏物。

definition.en: a person who tries to find underground water, minerals, or other hidden things by using a forked stick, rods, or a pendulum (a practice called dowsing)
definition.zh: 探水者；占测者（用叉状木棍、金属杆或摆锤等来寻找地下水、矿物或隐藏物的“探测/占测”行为，称为 dowsing）

examples.en: In some rural areas, dowsers are still asked to locate a good spot for a well.
examples.zh: 在一些乡村地区，人们仍会请探水者来找适合打井的位置。

examples.en: The farmer hired a dowser, but the results were not scientifically verified.
examples.zh: 那位农民雇了探水者，但结果并没有科学验证。

extraExplanation: “Dowser”来自动词“dows(e)”（用占测法寻找地下水等）。在英语文化中，dowsing常与“民间传统/超自然能力”联系在一起，但在现代科学界普遍被认为缺乏可靠证据。写作中可用中性表述（如“traditional dowser”）以避免直接贬义。

summary.en: “dowses” most commonly means “searches for underground water/minerals by dowsing”; less commonly it means “soaks/drenches with liquid.”
summary.zh: “dowses”常指“用探水法寻找地下水/矿物”；较少见时指“用液体浇湿、弄得湿透”。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “dowse”) to look for underground water, minerals, or other hidden things using a divining rod or other tool, based on a belief rather than scientific proof.
definition.zh: （“dowse”的第三人称单数）用探水杖等工具“占测”地下水、矿物或其他隐藏物体（多基于信念或民间做法，科学证据不足）。

examples.en: He dowses for water on rural land before digging a well.
examples.zh: 他在乡村地里用探水法找水源，然后才挖井。

examples.en: Some people say she dowses with a Y-shaped branch.
examples.zh: 有人说她用Y字形树枝来探测。

definition.en: (less common) to drench or soak something with liquid; to splash a lot of water onto something.
definition.zh: （较少见）把……浇湿；用液体把……弄得湿透；大量泼洒。

examples.en: He dowses the campfire with water to make sure it’s out.
examples.zh: 他用水把营火浇透，确保完全熄灭。

examples.en: The wave dowses the front row of spectators.
examples.zh: 海浪把第一排观众浇得一身湿。

extraExplanation: “dowsing（探水/占测）”在英语文化里常和“divining rod（探水杖/占卜杖）”一起出现，属于民俗做法：有人相信身体或工具能对地下水产生反应，但科学界普遍认为缺乏可靠证据。写作或新闻中使用时，常带有“民间方法/争议性”的语气。

summary.en: Dowse means to search for underground water using rods, or to splash/soak something with water; it can also mean to put out lights (especially nautical use).
summary.zh: Dowse 可指用探水杖寻找地下水，也可指泼水/浇湿；在航海语境中还可指“熄灯”。

definition.en: to search for underground water (or minerals) by using a forked stick or rods, based on the belief they will move when near water
definition.zh: （用“探水杖/占水棒”等）探测地下水或矿物；以为棒子靠近水源时会有反应

examples.en: Some people still dowse for water in rural areas.
examples.zh: 在一些乡村地区，仍有人用探水的方法寻找水源。

examples.en: They hired someone to dowse before digging a well.
examples.zh: 他们在打井前请人来探水。

definition.en: to splash or soak something with water; to drench
definition.zh: 泼水；把……浇湿/淋透

examples.en: She dowsed the fire with a bucket of water.
examples.zh: 她用一桶水把火浇灭了。

examples.en: He got dowsed by a passing car on a rainy day.
examples.zh: 雨天一辆车开过，他被溅了一身水。

definition.en: to put out (a light), especially on a ship; to darken
definition.zh: （尤指在船上）熄灯；使变暗

examples.en: At night, they dowsed the lights on deck.
examples.zh: 夜里他们把甲板上的灯都熄了。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“dowset”更常见的对应词是“dowse”。“dowsing（探水术）”在英语文化里常被当作民间方法或传统做法，但在科学上缺乏可靠证据支持；在正式写作中可用“search for groundwater”来替代，语气更中性。
相关常见搭配：a dowsing rod（探水杖/占水棒），water divining（探水、占水，较文学或古风的说法）。

summary.en: “Dowsets” is the plural of “dowset,” a Scottish term meaning a dowry or marriage settlement.
summary.zh: “dowsets”是“dowset”的复数，指苏格兰语境中的“嫁妆/婚姻财产安排”。

definition.en: (Scots, law) a dowry or marriage settlement; property given to a bride (or set aside for her) at marriage.
definition.zh: （苏格兰用法／法律）嫁妆；婚姻财产安排：结婚时给予新娘（或为她预留）的财产。

examples.en: In old Scottish records, the bride’s dowset was listed along with the groom’s lands.
examples.zh: 在旧的苏格兰档案里，新娘的 dowset（嫁妆/婚姻财产安排）常与新郎的土地一起被记录。

examples.en: Her family promised a generous dowset to support the new household.
examples.zh: 她的家人承诺提供丰厚的嫁妆（dowset），以支撑新家庭的生活。

extraExplanation: “dowset”在现代英语里非常少见，主要出现在苏格兰历史、法律文件或文学语境中。你输入的“dowsets”通常是复数形式（多个嫁妆/多份婚姻财产安排），单数是“dowset”。
词源上与“dower”（寡妇产/嫁妆相关概念）同属婚姻财产制度语汇，但“dowset”更偏苏格兰语境。

summary.en: Dowsing is the practice of using rods or a pendulum to try to find underground water or hidden things; it can also mean doing that practice.
summary.zh: dowsing 指用探测杆或摆锤来寻找地下水或隐藏物品的做法，也可作动词表示“进行探水/占测”。

definition.en: The practice of trying to find underground water, minerals, or other hidden things by using a forked stick, rods, or a pendulum (often based on belief rather than science).
definition.zh: 探水术／占测寻物：用Y形树枝、金属杆或摆锤来“探测”地下水、矿物或隐藏物品的一种做法（多基于信念，科学证据不足）。

examples.en: Some farmers used dowsing to look for a good place to dig a well.
examples.zh: 有些农民用探水术来找适合挖井的位置。

examples.en: The documentary explains why many scientists consider dowsing unreliable.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片解释了为什么许多科学家认为探水术不可靠。

definition.en: To try to find underground water, minerals, or hidden objects using a dowsing rod or pendulum.
definition.zh: 用探水棒／摆锤等进行探测（地下水、矿物或隐藏物品）。

examples.en: He claimed he could dowse for water in dry areas.
examples.zh: 他声称自己能在干旱地区探测到水源。

examples.en: They hired someone to dowse before drilling.
examples.zh: 他们在钻井前雇人先做探测。

extraExplanation: “Dowsing”也常被称为“water divining / water witching”（探水、寻水）。在英语语境里它常被当作民间传统或伪科学话题来讨论。
从语言上看，dowsing 与古英语中表示“打击/击打”的词根有关，后来意义发展为“用探测杆寻找东西”。在现代用法里，多指用杆或摆锤进行“占测式”寻找。

summary.en: “Dowski” is typically a surname (a proper name), not a standard English word with a fixed meaning.
summary.zh: “Dowski”通常是姓氏（专有名词），并非有固定含义的常规英语单词。

definition.en: A surname (family name). It is used as a proper name for a person, but it is not a common English vocabulary word with a standard dictionary meaning.
definition.zh: 一个姓氏（家族名）。它用作人名的专有名词，但不是英语里常见、具有固定词典义的普通词汇。

examples.en: Ms. Dowski will lead the meeting today.
examples.zh: Dowski 女士今天将主持会议。

examples.en: I saw the name “Dowski” on the class list.
examples.zh: 我在班级名单上看到了“Dowski”这个名字。

extraExplanation: “-ski / -sky”结尾的姓氏在英语世界里常见于东欧或斯拉夫背景的家族名（例如波兰、俄罗斯等地区的移民后裔）。在一些语言里，“-ski”历史上可带有“……的/来自……的”之类的含义，但在英语中通常只把它当作姓氏来使用。
如果你是在某个具体语境（比如小说人物、品牌、游戏ID、歌词）里看到“Dowski”，它可能是作者自造名或变体拼写。给我一句原文/截图语境，我可以帮你判断更准确的含义。

summary.en: Dowson is usually a surname; it can also refer to the English poet Ernest Dowson (1867–1900).
summary.zh: Dowson 通常是一个姓氏；也可指英国诗人欧内斯特·道森（1867–1900）。

definition.en: a surname (family name).
definition.zh: 姓氏（家族姓）。

examples.en: Her last name is Dowson.
examples.zh: 她的姓是 Dowson。

examples.en: I met a Dr. Dowson at the conference.
examples.zh: 我在会议上见到一位叫 Dowson 的医生。

definition.en: Ernest Dowson (1867–1900), an English poet and writer known for melancholy, musical verse and for influencing later literature.
definition.zh: 欧内斯特·道森（Ernest Dowson，1867–1900），英国诗人和作家，以忧郁、富有音乐感的诗歌闻名，并影响了后来的文学。

examples.en: In class we read a poem by Ernest Dowson.
examples.zh: 课上我们读了一首欧内斯特·道森的诗。

examples.en: Dowson is often discussed alongside other writers of the Decadent movement.
examples.zh: 道森常常与颓废派运动的其他作家一起被讨论。

extraExplanation: “Dowson”最常指英国诗人 Ernest Dowson。他的一句拉丁诗行“Non sum qualis eram bonae sub regno Cynarae”很有名，常被译为“我已不再是从前那个我（在美好的 Cynara 统治下）”，表达对逝去爱情与青春的怀念。
英语里常见短语“days of wine and roses”（葡萄酒与玫瑰的日子，指享乐而短暂的美好时光）通常被认为与 Dowson 的诗句有关，因此在文学与流行文化中经常引用。

summary.en: “Dowve” is not a standard English word; you probably mean “dove” (a bird, a peace symbol, or the past of “dive”).
summary.zh: “dowve”不是标准英文词；你可能想写“dove”（鸽子/和平象征/动词dive的过去式）。

definition.en: a dove: a small bird related to pigeons, often seen as gentle and calm
definition.zh: 鸽子：一种与鸽科近缘的小鸟，常给人温和、安静的感觉

examples.en: A white dove flew over the park.
examples.zh: 一只白鸽飞过公园。

examples.en: They kept doves in a small cage in the garden.
examples.zh: 他们在花园里用小笼子养鸽子。

definition.en: a symbol of peace or hope (often used in art, stories, and news)
definition.zh: 和平或希望的象征（常见于艺术、故事与新闻表达）

examples.en: The dove is a common symbol of peace.
examples.zh: 鸽子是常见的和平象征。

examples.en: The poster showed a dove and an olive branch.
examples.zh: 海报上画着一只鸽子和一根橄榄枝。

definition.en: (AmE) past tense of “dive”: to go down quickly into water or move down suddenly
definition.zh: （美式英语）“dive”的过去式：潜入水中；或突然向下冲

examples.en: He dove into the pool.
examples.zh: 他跳入泳池。

examples.en: The goalkeeper dove to stop the ball.
examples.zh: 守门员飞身扑救。

extraExplanation: “dowve”不是标准英文单词，更常见的是拼写错误：你可能想写的是 **dove**。
注意 **dove** 在美式英语里有两种常见读音：表示“鸽子”通常读 /dʌv/；表示动词“dive”的过去式常读 /doʊv/（不同地区也有人用 /dɪvd/ 作为过去式）。

summary.en: “dowy” is not standard; it’s usually a misspelling of “dowdy” (= unfashionable, dull-looking).
summary.zh: “dowy”不是标准用法，通常是把“dowdy”拼错了（= 不时髦、显得土气/朴素甚至有点沉闷）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; most often a misspelling of “dowdy,” meaning unfashionable and (often) a bit dull in appearance.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语词；最常见是把“dowdy”拼错了，意思是“穿着不时髦的、显得土气/朴素甚至有点沉闷的”。

examples.en: I think you mean “dowdy”: Her outfit looked dowdy compared with everyone else’s.
examples.zh: 你可能想写“dowdy”：和其他人相比，她的穿着显得有点土气。

examples.en: He wore a dowdy suit that didn’t fit well.
examples.zh: 他穿了一套不合身、看起来不太时髦的西装。

extraExplanation: “dowdy”是常用词，带一点主观评价色彩，可能显得不太礼貌；描述他人外表时更中性的话可以用：plain（朴素的）、simple（简洁的）、unfashionable（不时髦的）。
“dowy”偶尔在网络上会作为拼写错误出现，但词典里一般不收录；如果你是在特定文本/游戏/人名里看到“Dowy”，也可能是专有名词。

summary.en: Dowzall is most likely a surname (a proper name), not a common English vocabulary word.
summary.zh: Dowzall 更可能是姓氏（专有名词），而不是常见英语词汇。

definition.en: a family name (surname); a proper noun used to identify a person or family named Dowzall
definition.zh: （姓氏）道扎尔（Dowzall）；用于指代名为 Dowzall 的个人或家族的专有名词

examples.en: Ms. Dowzall will lead the meeting today.
examples.zh: Dowzall 女士今天将主持会议。

examples.en: I saw the name Dowzall on the guest list.
examples.zh: 我在宾客名单上看到了 Dowzall 这个名字。

extraExplanation: “Dowzall”并不是常见的英语词汇，更常见的用法是作为姓氏（因此通常首字母大写）。如果你是在阅读文章、看名单或做家谱研究时遇到它，它很可能是人名的一部分。
专有名词（人名、地名、机构名）一般不翻译含义，而是按习惯音译或直接保留原拼写；在中文语境里也常直接写作“Dowzall”。
如果你能提供上下文句子（例如它出现在什么文本里、前后有哪些词），我可以更准确判断它是人名、地名、品牌名，还是拼写变体/误拼。
